0.title: Delhi's peak power demand crosses 7,000 MW-mark, highest ever in May
0.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand rose to 7,070 MW (megawatts) on Thursday, the highest ever in May and this year's highest so far. Notably, the previous highest peak power demand for the month of May in Delhi was 6,780 MW on May 13, 2022. Delhi's peak power demand crossed the 7,000 MW-mark for the first time on July 10, 2018.

1.title: Diversity never caused any conflict in India: Rajnath Singh
1.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said India is the only country where people from different religions live in harmony and its diversity has never been the cause of any conflict. "Seventy-two sects of Muslim society are found in this country. India's oldest church dates back years ago," Singh said while addressing a religious gathering in Vadodara.

2.title: 33 die as strong winds, rains hit Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
2.article_body: As many as 33 people have died in 16 districts of Bihar due to thunderstorms and lightning amid strong winds and heavy rains. CM Nitish Kumar announced ₹4 lakh ex-gratia each to the family of the deceased. "I'm deeply saddened to see that many people died in the incidents of thunderstorm and lightning in Bihar," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

3.title: Dhanush sends legal notice to couple claiming him to be their biological son
3.article_body: Indian actor Dhanush and his father Kasthuri Raja have sent a court notice to a Madurai-based couple who claim that Dhanush is their biological son. In the notice, they have asked the couple to stop making "specious" claim regarding Dhanush. They have also requested the couple to publish a public statement admitting that all of their charges are baseless.

4.title: DC owner Parth Jindal trolled for his 'Never liked anyone doing any favours for us' tweet
4.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) owner Parth Jindal has been trolled for his tweet ahead of DC-MI match. "Never liked anyone doing any favours for us anyway...equation is simple...we win on Saturday and we get the opportunity of going further in IPL," he had written. Fans shared a video of DC players rooting for GT to defeat RCB by saying GT's slogan.

5.title: Which countries have reported cases of monkeypox so far?
5.article_body: More than 80 cases of monkeypox have been confirmed in at least 12 countries so far. Infections have been confirmed in nine European countries, as well as the US, Canada and Australia. Public health agencies in Europe have confirmed cases in UK, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Belgium, France, Netherlands, Italy and Sweden. There are now 20 confirmed cases in UK.

6.title: CBI officials misbehaved with Rabri Devi: RJD
6.article_body: After the CBI team raided Rabri Devi's residence in Patna for being accused in a corruption case, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) alleged that CBI officials "misbehaved" with Rabri Devi and used "unparliamentary language" during their interrogation. "We reiterate that the latest CBI case and the raids conducted across the country...are sponsored by BJP," RJD's spokesperson said.

7.title: Villagers perform death ritual of Thane hospital to protest mismanagement
7.article_body: Residents of adjoining villages gathered outside the government-run Indira Gandhi Hospital in Thane's Bhiwandi area and performed the death ritual of the healthcare facility to protest its mismanagement on Friday. They brought a big portrait of the "dead" hospital, garlanded it and performed the mock death rituals to draw the management's attention towards lack of basic facilities at the hospital.

8.title: 7 die, 10 injured after vehicle rams into tree in Karnataka's Dharwad
8.article_body: At least seven persons died and 10 were injured after their vehicle rammed into a tree in Nigadi in Karnataka's Dharwad on Friday night, police said. The vehicle was carrying 21 people who were travelling to Benkankatti after attending a wedding, police stated. A case has been registered under section 304A of the IPC (causing death by negligence), police stated.

9.title: Maha govt concerned about bar operators rather than farmers: Fadnavis
9.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government was more concerned about bar operators and reducing the prices of foreign liquor than solving problems faced by farmers. The MVA government has not given a penny to those affected by storms and heavy rains, the former Maharashtra CM said at a farmers' rally in Solapur.

10.title: 40 people injured, houses damaged as tornado hits Germany
10.article_body: A tornado swept through parts of western Germany on Friday injuring around 40 people, "10 of them seriously", police said. The tornado damaged several homes, disrupted traffic and uprooted trees that toppled onto rail tracks and roads. The German Weather Service has warned that the stormy weather was set to continue. Police have asked locals to stay at home.

11.title: CBI raids brokers in Delhi, Mumbai & other cities in NSE co-location scam case
11.article_body: The CBI on Saturday carried out a coordinated search operation at over 10 locations in multiple cities in connection with the NSE co-location scam case. The searches will cover brokers at more than 12 premises in Mumbai, Delhi and Kolkata, among others. Notably, CBI has filed a chargesheet against former NSE CEO and MD Chitra Ramkrishna in the case.

12.title: I did not want to kill, I was nervous: Russian soldier who killed 62-year-old Ukrainian
12.article_body: A 21-year-old Russian soldier told a court that he "sincerely repented" killing an unarmed 62-year-old civilian in the northeast Ukrainian village of Chupakhivka on February 28. "I was nervous at the time, I did not want to kill...that's how it happened," Vadim Shishimarin said. Shishimarin is accused of firing several shots with an assault rifle at the civilian's head.

13.title: Nath praises BJP workers, says 'no one goes to tell them to work'
13.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Friday praised BJP workers, saying, "In the BJP, no one goes to tell the people on the ground that they have to go here or there and do so-and-so work." However, he added that Congress workers "wait for someone to tell them what to do". He further said that this was Congress' "only drawback".

14.title: Delhi govt gets 2 remote-controlled robots to help douse fires
14.article_body: The Delhi government has procured two remote-controlled fire fighting robots. While the robots are under trial, if they seem successful, more such machines will be introduced to the firefighting fleet, said Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain. The robots can release water at a high pressure of 2,400 litres/minute which will help in dousing fires faster.

15.title: Gang hacks man to death in broad daylight in TN; act caught on CCTV
15.article_body: Two people have surrendered in a court after a gang of four hacked a 36-year-old man to death in broad daylight on a road in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The incident, captured on CCTV footage, shows the gang attacking the deceased as he falls on the road. An official said that the deceased had a few pending cases filed against him.

16.title: Oracle co-founder joined call about contesting Trump's defeat: Report
16.article_body: Oracle's billionaire Co-founder Larry Ellison participated in a November 2020 call in which US President Donald Trump's allies brainstormed ways to contest the results of the presidential election, media reports said citing an email. The phone call included Senator Lindsey Graham and longtime Trump legal adviser Jay Sekulow. Ellison had openly supported Trump during the 2020 campaign.

17.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad police arrest 88 history-sheeters in combing op
17.article_body: As many as 88 history-sheeters who were found violating rules were arrested by the Pimpri-Chinchwad police during a massive combing operation. According to the police, 130 criminals were checked during the drive against anti-social elements and offenders on record, in which all of the force's squads were activated. Flying squads were also deployed during the night, the police said.

18.title: Video of 'coal theft' in a Chhattisgarh's coal mine goes viral, probe ordered
18.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Police ordered a probe into a viral video that showed a large number of people digging and carrying away coal illegally from SECL's opencast coal mine in Chhattisgarh's Korba district. After the video went viral, Korba Collector Ranu Sahu visited the mines and claimed that no attempt was made by SECL to stop any such theft.

19.title: Releasing Warner SRH's biggest mistake, should've never let him go: Sehwag
19.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said releasing opener David Warner has been SRH's "biggest" mistake, adding that they should have never let him go irrespective of what happened. "SRH...should have backed Warner, which they did not do," stated Sehwag. "Anyone can have a poor season. Virat Kohli only recently scored that fifty otherwise his season has been really bad," said Sehwag.

20.title: 18-yr-old girl dies by suicide over being scolded for using phone in Thane
20.article_body: An 18-year-old girl died by suicide in Thane's Dombivli after her elder brother scolded her for spending too much time on her mobile phone. According to police, the deceased's brother had removed the SIM card from her phone before going to work on Thursday. On returning home, he found his sister hanging by a rod on the ceiling, police said.

21.title: Keep a close watch on monkeypox situation: Health Minister to officials
21.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has directed the officials at National Centre for Disease Control and ICMR to keep a close watch on the monkeypox situation. The airport and port health officers are asked to be vigilant. They have been reportedly instructed to isolate any sick passenger with a travel history to monkeypox-affected countries and send samples for investigation.

22.title: Zelenskyy proposes deal to secure Russian compensation for invasion
22.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy proposed a formal deal with the country's allies to obtain Russian compensation for the damage caused by its forces during war. Under the deal, Russian funds and property in signatory nations will be seized and directed to a special compensation fund, he added. "Russia will feel...weight of every missile...bomb...which it has fired at us," he said.

23.title: Ashwin's confidence in his ability found in very few players: Shastri
23.article_body: Reacting to RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's 40* off 23 balls against CSK, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "His shot selection under pressure was outstanding. Ashwin targeted the right bowlers and pulled out the big strokes when needed." "The kind of confidence he has in his ability, you find that in very few cricketers," added Shastri.

24.title: Pit viper's venom neutralised with compound from fruits, vegetables
24.article_body: The venom of a pit viper can be neutralised using a substance found in fruits and vegetables, scientists said. They found that a modified version of the compound rutin, the water-soluble succinyl rutin, can delay the effect of a bite. The Bothrops jararaca is reportedly responsible for Brazil's roughly 26,000 recorded snake bites each year.

25.title: 'Tourists who want an exciting time can come', jokes Sri Lanka PM; video viral
25.article_body: During an interview, when asked if it is safe for tourists to visit Sri Lanka, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe joked that tourists who "want to have an exciting" time can come. He added, "Maybe they could take part in the demonstration" or hold placards against the President. Meanwhile, the journalist remarked that his question on tourism was a serious one.

26.title: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal leader Tota Singh passes away aged 81
26.article_body: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader and a three-time Punjab MLA Tota Singh passed away aged 81 at a private hospital in Mohali on Saturday after a prolonged illness. "He was a father figure to me...His invaluable advice...will always be missed," SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted. Tota Singh had served as the agriculture and education minister in Punjab.

27.title: BJP has spread kerosene all over the country: Rahul Gandhi
27.article_body: Addressing 'Ideas for India' conclave in London, Rahul Gandhi criticised BJP and said that the ruling party has spread kerosene all over the country, adding that only one spark could lead to a "big trouble". "India is not in a good place...I think it's also the responsibility of Opposition to bring people, communities, states and religions together," Gandhi said.

28.title: CSK win only because of MS Dhoni's captaincy, he brings luck: Sehwag
28.article_body: Virender Sehwag said CSK win "only" because of MS Dhoni's captaincy and the manner in which he utilises his resources. "I don't think anyone can lead the side like [him]," he added. "Dhoni brings [luck] with him," stated Sehwag. "Just imagine how CSK would fare if Dhoni's not there. He'll only leave once he finds a suitable...[leader]," he said.

29.title: 7 get life imprisonment for raping Bangladeshi woman in Bengaluru
29.article_body: All the 12 accused in the Bangladeshi woman gang rape incident in Bengaluru in May 2021 got convicted by a Bengaluru court on Friday. Out of the 12 accused, seven got life imprisonment, one got 20-years in jail, and two more got 9 months in jail. The accused were human traffickers and 11 of them were illegal migrants from Bangladesh.

30.title: Trump pays over ₹85 lakh fine after being held in contempt of court
30.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has paid a $110,000 (over ₹85 lakh) fine after being held in contempt of court. The New York Attorney General's office moved to hold Trump in contempt for not handing over business-related documents for a probe. The office is investigating whether the Trump Organization falsely reported property values to secure loans and obtain tax benefits.

31.title: Naxal-affected Bastar is changing as roads & schools are built: CM Baghel
31.article_body: With the development of roads, bridges and schools, the situation in Naxal-affected Bastar is changing, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said. "Bastar is changing and development work is underway," he said. "Schools reopened after about 15 years...People are getting benefits from state government schemes," he added. "Bastar is developing in health, income and education," Baghel said.

32.title: Man asks Nagpur bakery on Swiggy if cake contains egg, his cake pic goes viral
32.article_body: A man in Maharashtra's Nagpur placed an order for a cake through Swiggy and in the details he remarked, "Please mention if the cake contains egg." Following this, he received a cake with the message "contain egg" written on it. He tweeted, "I am speechless after receiving the order." A Twitter user commented, "This is such a funny mistake."

33.title: Topless woman crashes Cannes to protest against sexual violence in Ukraine
33.article_body: A topless woman crashed the Cannes Film Festival 2022 red carpet to protest against sexual violence in Ukraine. The woman appeared to be wearing body paint in the colours of the flag of Ukraine. She was heard screaming 'Stop raping us' as she was escorted off the red carpet by the security personnel.

34.title: Salman must be bhai for others, for me he is my jaan: World champion boxer Nikhat Zareen
34.article_body: Nikhat Zareen, who recently won gold medal in Women's World Boxing Championships, in an interview, said that Salman Khan must be 'bhai' for others, but for her he is her 'jaan' (life). She added that it is her dream to meet Salman. The actor later took to Twitter to congratulate Nikhat on winning the gold medal.

35.title: 6 die, 3 injured as SUV collides with tractor-trolley in UP's Balrampur
35.article_body: At least six persons were killed and three others were injured after an SUV and a tractor-trolley collided head-on on the Tulsipur-Barhni National Highway in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur on Friday, police said. A 13-year-old boy died in a hospital, police added. The accident took place when the victims were travelling from Laxmanpur to Bhagwanpur, police further said.

36.title: HP Assembly's Dy Speaker purportedly slaps student at school; video surfaces
36.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Assembly Deputy Speaker Hans Raj purportedly slapped a school student in Chamba district, with a video of the incident surfacing on social media. "Why are you laughing?" Hans Raj can be heard saying in the video. Criticising Hans Raj, Congress MLA Vikramaditya Singh termed the incident "unfortunate and unacceptable".

37.title: Unfair on Jadeja but inevitable: Ajay Jadeja on CSK captaincy change
37.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to wicketkeeper-batter MS Dhoni earlier during IPL 2022, former India batter Ajay Jadeja said it was unfair on Jadeja but inevitable considering Dhoni's presence. "There hasn't been a leader like Dhoni," added Ajay. CSK registered six defeats in their opening eight games of IPL 2022 under Jadeja's captaincy.

38.title: Dominica withdraws case against Mehul Choksi over 'illegal entry'
38.article_body: Authorities in Dominica have discontinued the proceedings against fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi over his 'illegal entry' into the island nation, officials said on Saturday. Choksi, who is wanted in connection to the ₹13,500 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case, had claimed he was abducted from Antigua and Barbuda and taken to Dominica against his will.

39.title: Tough to pick his bowling, he'll contribute in a big way: Dhoni on Pathirana
39.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni termed his team's Sri Lankan bowler Matheesha Pathirana as their Lasith Malinga, with both Pathirana and Malinga having a similar action while bowling. "Pathirana is really good. It is difficult to pick him and...he will definitely contribute next year...in a big way," added Dhoni. Pathirana had an economy rate of 7.60 in IPL 2022.

40.title: Don't replace Mahatma Gandhi's statue in Secunderabad: Cong appeals to GHMC
40.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Marri Shashidhar Reddy and other party leaders on Friday appealed to the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) not to replace Mahatma Gandhi's statue at James Street in Secunderabad. "It reminds us of Tughlaq's rule. Installing another statue in the same place is unfortunate, we are against it," Reddy said, adding that the statue has historical significance.

41.title: Rahul remembers father Rajiv on his death anniversary, calls him 'visionary'
41.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi remembered his late father and former PM Rajiv Gandhi on the latter's 31st death anniversary on Saturday. "My father was a visionary leader whose policies helped shape modern India," Rahul tweeted. "He was compassionate...and a wonderful father to me and Priyanka...I dearly miss him and fondly remember the time we spent together," he added.

42.title: Drugs worth ₹17 lakh seized in B'luru in separate incidents; 2 held
42.article_body: The CCB Anti-Narcotics squad has arrested two drug peddlers, including a Tanzanian national, in separate incidents and recovered drugs worth a total of ₹17 lakh from their possession, according to Bengaluru City Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime). One of the accused used to sell the drugs near a college, the police said. The seized drugs include ganja and MDMA.

43.title: Rahul Gandhi is neither scoring runs nor taking wickets: BJP's Raman Singh
43.article_body: BJP's Raman Singh said that Congress wants to make Rahul Gandhi a captain when he himself does not want to be one. "He is not ready to become a non-playing captain either. Rahul Gandhi is neither scoring runs nor taking wickets," Singh added. "After this 'Chintan Shivir', there will be no Congress government left in any state," Singh further said.

44.title: Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka pay homage to Rajiv Gandhi on 31st death anniversary
44.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi along with daughter and party General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra paid homage to former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 31st death anniversary at Vir Bhumi in Delhi. Congress leaders P Chidambaram and Sachin Pilot also paid tributes to Gandhi at his memorial. Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated during an election rally in Tamil Nadu in 1991.

45.title: Ola, Uber get notices by CCPA over alleged unfair trade practices
45.article_body: Ola and Uber have been given notices by the CCPA for alleged unfair trade practices and violation of consumer rights. CCPA said most of the consumer complaints received in the last year are related to "deficiency in services and other unfair trade practices". Over 3,170 consumer complaints were registered against Ola and Uber in the 12 months till 1 May.

46.title: How does monkeypox spread from person to person?
46.article_body: According to WHO, people with monkeypox are infectious while they have symptoms. "You can catch monkeypox through close physical contact with someone who has symptoms. Rash, bodily fluids and scabs are particularly infectious. Clothing, bedding...utensils that have been contaminated from contact with infected person can also infect others. Ulcers...in the mouth can also be infectious," WHO said.

47.title: HC removes WB minister's daughter from job over appointment scam
47.article_body: Calcutta High Court on Friday dismissed West Bengal minister PC Adhikary's daughter Ankita from her job as a teacher at a state government-aided school and ordered her to return the salary she's received since 2018. The court gave the order while hearing a petition over Ankita's alleged appointment as a teacher despite another candidate securing higher marks in recruitment test.

48.title: CCTV footage shows moment when speeding car hits 4 pedestrians in B'luru
48.article_body: A man was killed and three others were injured after a speeding car hit them while they were walking on the side of a road in Bengaluru. The accident, which was caught on CCTV, showed one of the pedestrians flying into the air before colliding with scooters parked nearby. The driver has been arrested in the case.

49.title: Rajnath Singh's flight diverted to Agra due to bad weather in Delhi: Reports
49.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's flight was diverted to Agra due to bad weather in Delhi on Friday, as per reports. Singh was going to Delhi after attending a function at Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Gujarat's Vadodara. "At least 11 flights including Defence Minister's flight...were diverted to Ahmedabad, Jaipur, Lucknow and Agra due to the unfavourable weather conditions," reports stated.

50.title: Jammu college students protest over mosque's loudspeaker; detained
50.article_body: At least six students from a government college in Jammu were detained on Friday after a group of them recited Hanuman Chalisa in a protest over the use of loudspeaker at a local mosque. The students alleged that their studies were being disturbed at the college. Earlier, the district's civic body had ordered the removal of loudspeakers operating without permission.

51.title: 3 people rob railway officer at knifepoint in Kalyan, arrested
51.article_body: The Kalyan Government Railway Police arrested three people for robbing a railway officer at knifepoint at Kalyan railway station. The incident occurred at around 2 am on Thursday when Chandrakant Karande was returning to his home in Kalyan. "We have recovered the phone and cash. The accused are drug addicts and plan such robberies for easy money," an officer said.

52.title: Suffered damages worth lakhs: Shopkeepers after fire at cycle market in Delhi
52.article_body: After a major fire gutted dozens of shops at the cycle market in Delhi's Jhandewalan on Friday, shopkeepers said they have suffered damages worth lakhs. "We suffered already during COVID...we gave salaries while sitting at home," a shop owner said. "Step by step, we were getting our customers back. But now, we've come back to square one," he added.

53.title: Taliban govt in Afghanistan has zero credibility on women's rights: HRW
53.article_body: Taliban leadership in Afghanistan has "zero credibility" on women's rights, Associate Women's Rights Director at Human Rights Watch Heather Barr said. "They made representations about their supposed respect for women/girls when taking power. Every day after there was a new crackdown on women & that continued to intensify," she added. Recently, Taliban ordered women to cover their faces in public.

54.title: Guru Randhawa’s audio brand DEFY launches new earbuds Gravity Pro
54.article_body: DEFY, certified by Commerzify as India's Most Trusted Brand, unveiled its latest earbuds Gravity Pro, revealing that it features 13mm drivers for immersive sound experience, 4mic ENC for superior call quality, and version 5.3 Bluetooth. The stem-styled wireless earbuds offer 25 hours of playback with 50 ms low latency in blue and black matte finish & white glossy finish variants.

55.title: 3M asked to pay $77 mn to US veteran over earplug hearing damage
55.article_body: A US court has ordered 3M to pay $77.5 million to a US Army veteran who claimed he suffered hearing damage after using the firm's military-issue earplugs. "We were prevented from presenting crucial evidence to the jury, and we will address that issue...in our appeal," 3M said. As of May 16, there were over 2,90,000 claims against the earplugs.

56.title: Took him so long to understand this?: Digvijaya on Jakhar's 'supremacy' remark
56.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised Sunil Jakhar over his "supremacy" remark against Congress and said, "So it took him so long to understand this?" Jakhar, who left Congress and joined BJP on Thursday, had said that supremacy in the Congress party lies with those who flatter high command adding that the Congress party has undergone "a huge change".

57.title: Man, woman die after jumping off flat on 22nd floor in Greater Noida
57.article_body: A man and woman died after they allegedly jumped off a flat on the 22nd floor in a housing society in Greater Noida (West) on Friday, police said. "Both the deceased knew each other. The flat...belonged to the man...the woman had come there...from her home in Ghaziabad," police added. The reason behind their step is yet unknown, police stated.

58.title: Mastermind behind ₹400-crore Citibank scam of 2010 dies of TB in Delhi
58.article_body: The alleged mastermind behind the ₹400-crore Citibank scam of 2010, who was lodged in Bhondsi prison, has died at a hospital in Delhi. Shivraj Puri was suffering from tuberculosis. Puri had allegedly forged documents and transferred ₹400 crore from various customers to fictitious accounts while he worked as a relationship manager with Citibank.

59.title: India reports 2,323 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,996
59.article_body: India has reported 2,323 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,259 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 14,996, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,348, according to the latest data.

60.title: Gavaskar says 'Hetmyer's wife has delivered, will he deliver for RR', fans react
60.article_body: While commentating during RR-CSK match, Sunil Gavaskar was heard saying, "Shimron Hetmyer's wife has delivered, will Hetmyer deliver for RR now?" Reacting to his remark, a fan commented, "Why Gavaskar Why?" Another wrote, "Not sure whether we have commentators or trolls on TV." "Are you kidding me?" wrote another.

61.title: Piyush Goyal to lead Indian delegation at World Economic Forum in Davos
61.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will lead India's delegation of ministers and business leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos from May 23-25. While the event took place virtually last year owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, the WEF was to be held earlier this year but was delayed to May due to the spread of the Omicron variant.

62.title: It is a planning disaster: Supreme Court on illegal construction in Delhi
62.article_body: Commenting on illegal construction in Delhi, Supreme Court said that it is a planning disaster which has occurred for several years. "Single plot houses are now five-storeyed buildings. Continued monitoring is essential as there is a tendency to repeat such acts," it added. SC was hearing an application filed by a Connaught Place property owner who was facing sealing orders.

63.title: Canada bans luxury goods trade with Russia
63.article_body: Canada said it's imposing more sanctions on Russian oligarchs and other associates of President Vladimir Putin and banning the import and export of luxury goods from Russia over Ukraine invasion. The import ban will target Russian goods, including alcoholic beverages, seafood and non-industrial diamonds, while the export ban will target luxury goods such as footwear, luxury clothing and jewellery.

64.title: Rajasthan has become a hub of crime: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore
64.article_body: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has claimed that Rajasthan has turned into a "hub of crime" under the Congress-run state government's regime. "On one side, Rajasthan tops in crime against women, on the other, it is at the lowest position in the implementation of welfare schemes," the MP from Jaipur Rural said.

65.title: Every Indian's chest will swell with pride: Rajnath on Indo-China face-off information
65.article_body: While talking about the 2020 Indo-China face-off, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "Won't say much on it. The way our Army had shown courage and worked charismatically, I will only say that if complete information could be given, every Indian's chest would swell with pride." Twenty Indian soldiers were martyred in the Galwan Valley face-off.

66.title: Samsung leader hosts Biden at plant after being excused from trial
66.article_body: Samsung Electronics Vice Chairman Jay Y Lee hosted US President Joe Biden's tour of a Samsung plant in South Korea, after being excused from attending an accounting fraud trial hearing on Friday. He was seen accompanying Biden and South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol. Biden toured the site of a third production line of the firm's chip production complex.

67.title: Fraudsters offer Mumbai engineer job in UK, cheats him of ₹9 lakh
67.article_body: A 52-year-old Mumbai-based civil engineer was cheated of ₹9 lakh by fraudsters who offered him a job in UK and even conducted fake interview before making him transfer the amount on pretext of making his documents. The complainant's friend had sent him an email related to a job opening and after applying for the same he got the fraud call.

68.title: 2 arrested with 140 kg poppy husk, 50,000 banned pills in Ferozepur
68.article_body: Police arrested two men and reportedly seized 140 kg of poppy husk, 50,000 banned pills and two smartphones from a truck in Ferozepur on Friday. The accused, identified as Kulwant Singh and Gurkirtan Singh, told police they had smuggled in the contraband from Rajasthan. Their other accomplice, Nirvair Singh, is at large.

69.title: Man made B'luru airport hoax bomb call to trap brother-in-law: Police
69.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a man who allegedly made a hoax bomb threat call at Kempegowda International Airport on Friday. The police said that the accused "wanted to trap his brother-in-law who is going through a divorce with his sister." During the call, the accused had reportedly said that the bomb at the airport would explode in 30 minutes.

70.title: Increased tourists footfall in Kashmir can’t be called normalcy: Omar Abdullah
70.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said the central government has failed to restore normalcy in Kashmir. "Flights and tourists are not [signs of] normalcy. Normalcy is when there's no fear and terror," he said. "No one is feeling secure amid targeted killings. The...fear is such that Pandit employees are ready to quit...jobs and run away," he added.

71.title: Mariupol steel plant 'completely liberated', claims Russia
71.article_body: Russia has claimed its soldiers have "completely liberated" the Azovstal steel plant in the southern Ukrainian city of Mariupol after the last 531 Ukrainian troops inside surrendered. Since May 16, 2,439 Ukrainian soldiers have laid down their arms, Russia's Defence Ministry said. Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has informed President Vladimir Putin of "the end of the operation", it added.

72.title: Local train services between Goregaon and Santacruz to be hit for 4 hrs
72.article_body: Mumbai's local train services will remain hit for four hours between Goregaon and Santacruz stations on intermediary night of Saturday (May 21) and Sunday (May 22) to carry out maintenance work. On Up fast line, the block will be from midnight 12 to 4 am, and on Down fast line, the block will be from 12.30 am to 4.30 am.

73.title: Pune jeweller attacked inside his shop, probe underway
73.article_body: A Pune-based jeweller was attacked inside his shop with a sharp object in the city's Ambegaon Budruk area. The accused had come into the shop disguised as a customer before attacking the victim, identified as Vinod Kumar Soni (42), on his head and hands which got the latter injured, police said. However, nothing was stolen from the shop.

74.title: Man stabbed to death over inter-caste marriage in Hyderabad
74.article_body: A man was stabbed to death allegedly by five people in Hyderabad's Begum Bazar on Friday night. The deceased, identified as Neeraj, had married a woman of another caste against her family's consent and police suspect role of his wife's family in the murder. According to police, Neeraj was travelling on a two-wheeler with his father when he was attacked.

75.title: Hindu College professor held for post on 'Shivling' at Gyanvapi mosque
75.article_body: A 50-year-old Associate Professor from Delhi University's Hindu College, Ratan Lal, was arrested for an objectionable online post in connection with the claims of a Shivling found at Varanasi's Gyanvapi mosque, police said. He had allegedly posted a photo of the structure and made objectionable comments, police added. Lal said he had asked police for security after receiving threats online.

76.title: Boeing's Starliner docks with space station for the first time
76.article_body: Boeing's new Starliner crew capsule docked with the International Space Station for the first time on Friday in an uncrewed flight test. Starliner lifted off on Thursday from the US despite the failure of two onboard thrusters. Boeing had said that the failed thrusters posed no risk to the rest of the spaceflight.

77.title: Tesla building hardcore litigation dept: Musk after sexual harassment claims
77.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted that Tesla is building a "hardcore litigation department", a day after a report accused him of sexually harassing a flight attendant in 2016. He added that while the team will directly report to him, listing his commitments he wrote, "We'll never seek victory in a just case against us, even if we will probably win."

78.title: Man forces wife to have physical relationship with friends in Pune
78.article_body: A case has been filed against a man for allegedly forcing his 48-year-old wife to have a physical relationship with two of his friends. The accused watched his friends committing the act, which took place in December 2020 and July 2021, according to the police. The wife had filed the complaint after she reportedly got fed up with constant harassment.

79.title: Russia to cut natural gas supplies to Finland, days after it applied to join NATO
79.article_body: Russia will stop supplying natural gas to Finland after the country which applied for NATO membership recently, refused to pay for its supplies in roubles. Finnish state-owned energy firm Gasum confirmed the news. Natural gas accounts for about eight per cent of Finland's energy consumption, most of which comes from Russia.

80.title: Google to temporarily let Match offer alternate payment systems
80.article_body: Tinder-owner Match Group has said Google will temporarily allow it to offer users a choice in payment systems. Earlier this month, Match had sued Google as a "last resort" to prevent Tinder and its other apps from being removed from the Play Store for refusing to share up to 30% of sales. The trial date is set for April 2023.

81.title: Ashwin thumps his chest 7 times to celebrate four against CSK, video goes viral
81.article_body: RR bowling all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin thumped his chest seven times to celebrate a four in the last over while chasing a 151-run target against CSK. A video of his celebration has gone viral on social media. While talking about the celebration, Ashwin said, "I just brought out the David Warner inside me."

82.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as 3 playoffs get booked?
82.article_body: With their five-wicket victory over CSK, RR finished on the second position on the IPL 2022 points table. They became the third team after GT and LSG to qualify for the playoffs. GT finished the league stage of the tournament on the first position. RR and LSG have 18 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR).

83.title: Kanika Kapoor marries NRI businessman Gautam Hathiramani in London; pics surface
83.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor got married to NRI businessman Gautam Hathiramani on Friday. The couple tied the knot in an intimate ceremony attended by family and close friends at a hotel in London. Pictures and videos from the ceremony were shared by their friends on their social media accounts.

84.title: Whose party is more fun: Ravi Shastri on pick between Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli
84.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked former India head coach Ravi Shastri to pick one between Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Responding to the fan, Shastri wrote, "Jiski bhi party mei zada mazze hai (Whose party is more fun)." "Ravi bhai, what is the definition of 'mazze'?" a fan jokingly commented.

85.title: Woman hangs self in Gurugram, leaves note on her hand blaming husband
85.article_body: A 24-year-old woman hanged herself at her parents' home in Gurugram's Palam Vihar extension on Thursday within three months of her marriage, police said. She allegedly wrote a note on her hand stating she had left a five-page suicide note, police added. In the note, the victim claimed that her 30-year-old husband and in-laws harassed her for dowry, police stated.

86.title: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by ₹2/kg to ₹75.61/kg; 2nd hike in 6 days
86.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of CNG in Delhi-NCR by ₹2 per kg to ₹75.61 per kg. For Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad, the increased CNG prices are now ₹78.17 per kg, while in Gurugram, it will cost ₹83.94 per kg. Notably, this is the second such hike in six days.

87.title: RR defeat CSK to officially qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs, finish 2nd on points table
87.article_body: RR defeated CSK by five wickets in their final league stage match of IPL 2022. With the win, RR officially qualified for the playoffs by finishing second on the points table. Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scored for RR with 59(44), while Ravichandran Ashwin scored 40*(23). RR will now face GT in Qualifier 1 at Eden Gardens in Kolkata on May 24 (Tuesday).

88.title: Online betting racket busted in Jabalpur, ₹21.55 lakh recovered
88.article_body: Police said that two persons were arrested after a raid on a cash collection centre of an online betting racket in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. Siddharth Bahuguna, Jabalpur SP, said that two more accused are absconding. "We have found ₹21.55 lakh in one locker at the centre," Bahuguna said. He added that the Income Tax Department was intimated for further probe.

89.title: Russia to halt gas supply to Finland on Saturday
89.article_body: Russia has informed Finland it will halt the natural gas supply from Saturday after the Finnish state-owned gas wholesaler refused to pay its Russian supplier in roubles. Russia had demanded that "unfriendly foreign buyers" must pay for gas using Russian currency because of sanctions imposed over the war in Ukraine. Notably, the move comes after Finland applied for NATO membership.

90.title: TMC distributes food, umbrellas to people in flood-hit Agartala
90.article_body: The Trinamool Congress distributed umbrellas and food packets to the flood-hit people in Agartala. The food donation drive was led by Tripura TMC President Subal Bhowmik and state in-charge Rajib Banerjee. "Waterlogging has created havoc in several places in the North East," Bhowmik said, alleging that the BJP-led Tripura government "has done nothing" in four years to solve this crisis.

91.title: Man arrested for murdering son and daughter-in-law in UP's Kanpur
91.article_body: A day after a newly-wed couple was found dead in Kanpur, the police arrested the man's father in the case. Police said that they arrested Deepak, a tea vendor, as he was present in the house when the incident took place. "Deepak later confessed to his crime, claiming that he killed his son and daughter-in-law with a knife," police said.

92.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro meets Elon Musk, calls his $44 bn Twitter bid a 'breath of hope'
92.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk in Brazil on Friday. Bolsonaro hailed Musk's $44 billion bid to acquire Twitter and said, "For us here it was like a breath of hope." They also talked about connectivity, investments, innovation and the use of technology to reinforce protection of the Amazon rainforest, Bolsonaro tweeted.

93.title: Germany to deliver 15 anti-aircraft tanks to Ukraine in July
93.article_body: The German Defence Ministry on Friday said that Ukraine will receive 15 anti-aircraft Gepard tanks from Germany in July. The announcement comes after a meeting between German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht and her Ukrainian counterpart Oleksii Reznikov. Separately, Germany pledged to provide seven howitzers to Ukraine and has started training Ukrainian troops on these guns.

94.title: Germany and France detect first cases of Monkeypox
94.article_body: Germany has detected its first case of monkeypox in a patient who developed skin lesions, a symptom of the disease, according to the German armed forces' medical service. France has also reported its first case of monkeypox in a 29-year-old man in its Île-de-France region. Recently, cases of monkeypox have been identified in several non-endemic countries.

95.title: Please erase it: Ravi Shastri to fan asking for reply to his sketch he made in 2 hours
95.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan shared a sketch of Ravi Shastri and asked the former India head coach to reply to it. The fan claimed that he had made the sketch within two hours. Shastri replied to the fan, writing, "Please mita de yaar (Please erase it)." Shastri also included crying emoji in his reply.

96.title: ₹7.4 crore stolen from payment gateway Razorpay using 'failed transactions'
96.article_body: Hackers and fraudsters have stolen ₹7.38 crore by tampering with the authorisation process of 831 transactions on the payment gateway Razorpay, the company said in a police complaint. The company conducted an internal investigation after its authorisation and authentication partner Fiserv said the transactions had failed. The transactions had taken place from March 6 to May 13 this year.

97.title: Hindujas top 2022 UK Rich List with £28 billion fortune, Lakshmi Mittal ranks 6th
97.article_body: Srichand and Gopichand Hinduja and family have topped The Sunday Times UK Rich List 2022 with a fortune of £28.472 billion. They are followed by Sir James Dyson who has a net worth of £23 billion and Mumbai-born property investor brothers David and Simon Reuben with £22.265 billion wealth. Lakshmi Niwas Mittal ranks 6th on the list with £17 billion.

98.title: India among top 25 countries exporting in defence: Rajnath Singh
98.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that India is now among the top 25 countries exporting in the defence sector while hailing the current government for India's development. "(Earlier) defence weapons were only bought from outside...Tanks, rockets, missiles and ammunition [were] all imported," Rajnath Singh said while addressing party workers. "India is now respected in the world," he added.

99.title: BRICS-led New Development Bank to set up regional office in India
99.article_body: The New Development Bank (NDB), established by the BRICS countries, has announced that it plans to open its Indian Regional Office at Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT City). The office aims to cater to infrastructure and sustainable development needs of the country. "IRO will be instrumental in enhancing...engagement with borrowers and stakeholders," NDB President Marcos Troyjo said.

100.title: Keep a close watch, isolate sick passengers: Govt amid monkeypox cases in Europe
100.article_body: Amid cases of monkeypox in few countries, government has directed officials to keep a close watch on the situation, PTI reported quoting official sources. Government also directed airport and port health officers to be vigilant. "They've been instructed that any sick passenger with travel history to...affected countries be isolated and samples sent...for investigation," an official source said.

101.title: NIA raids 7 places in Jharkhand in terror funding case
101.article_body: National Investigation Agency on Friday conducted searches at seven places in Jharkhand in terror funding case of Magadh Amrapali Colliery, ANI reported. During the searches, the NIA reportedly recovered over ₹3 lakh in cash. The case pertains to raising of terror funds and money laundering by splinter group of Naxals in Left Wing Extremism affected states of Jharkhand and Bihar.

102.title: Other crises shouldn't be forgotten amid focus on Ukraine, says UN
102.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Filippo Grandi, on Friday said that countries focused on helping Ukraine should not ignore other crises. "Ukraine has an impact on many other fragile situations, making them more fragile, food security, energy crisis, price increases, instability," he added. The number of displaced people globally reached 8.4 crore in late 2021, he claimed.

103.title: Jeremy Renner finishes shooting in India, pens note for Indian crew
103.article_body: Hollywood actor Jeremy Renner, best known for portraying Hawkeye in Marvel films, recently finished shooting for his upcoming project in India. He shared a note on social media, writing, "Thank you to our amazing crew here in India who worked so hard with us to get this job done!" Jeremy was earlier spotted with actor Anil Kapoor in Rajasthan.

104.title: What are the key facts on Indian incomes revealed in State of Inequality report?
104.article_body: As per the latest State of Inequality in India report, the total earnings of the top 1% (₹1,27,48,00,000) were three times that of the total earnings of the bottom 10% (₹32,10,00,000). The top 1% accounted for 6-7% of the total income earned in India while the top 10% got 30-35%. The bottom 50% earned around 22% of total income.

105.title: Haven't watched but know the story: Akshay on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
105.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar was asked at a media interaction about 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' starring Kartik Aaryan which is the sequel to his 2007 film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa'. The actor said that he has not watched the film yet but knows the story and is going to watch it soon. Kartik had earlier said that it's better if comparisons are not drawn.

106.title: Indian Coast Guard seizes 218 kg drugs worth over ₹1,500 crore
106.article_body: Indian agencies have arrested a gang of international smugglers and seized around 218 kilograms of heroin worth more than ₹1,500 crore off the Lakshadweep coast. The heroin was recovered from two fishing boats named "Prince" and "Little Jesus". The recovery was made during a joint operation conducted by Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI).

107.title: I don't understand the term pan-India: Akshay Kumar on Bollywood vs South cinema debate
107.article_body: Akshay Kumar has reacted to the ongoing debate between South and Hindi cinema and said, "I don't believe in this divide.. We're all one industry." "I hope every film works...This word pan-India, I don't understand it," he added. I think the day we realise...we're one industry, things will start working better for us," Akshay stated.

108.title: Woman killed in attack by wild elephants in MP's Shahdol
108.article_body: Officials said that a couple sleeping outside their house in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district was attacked by a herd of wild elephants from neighbouring Chhattisgarh. "The woman was trampled to death by the elephants, while her husband escaped with minor injuries," said the Jaisinghnagar forest range officer. The deceased's family was given a compensation of ₹4 lakh, the official added.

109.title: Parts of Delhi-NCR receive rainfall, dust storm predicted tomorrow
109.article_body: Parts of Delhi and Gurugram received rainfall and strong winds on Friday, bringing some relief from the scorching heat over the past few days. Stormy weather with lightning was also reported from some areas of Noida. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a dust storm or thunderstorm with light to moderate rainfall in NCR on Saturday.

110.title: Depp's star power dimmer over unprofessional behaviour on set: Ex-agent
110.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's former agent Tracey Jacobs has testified in the ongoing defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, saying his star power "dimmed" due to unprofessional behaviour on sets. Tracey said that the crews loved him but would have to wait hours for him to arrive. Depp also asked United Talent Agency to give him $20 million, Jacobs added.

111.title: Indian Air Force rescues cancer patient from flood-hit Assam
111.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) rescued a cancer patient who was returning after treatment and got stuck at Haflong railway station amid the floods in Assam. IAF officials said that the patient was shifted to a nearby area safely. The floods have affected over 3.31 lakh people in Assam's Nagaon district alone, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

112.title: China launches military drills amid Biden's first Asia trip as Prez
112.article_body: China has launched military drills in the disputed South China Sea amid Joe Biden's first visit to Asia as the US President. China's Maritime Safety Administration office said that other aircraft and vessels will be prohibited from entering the area. Notably, Biden's visit is largely focused on countering the perceived threat from China, according to a report.

113.title: Delhi govt raises DA for labourers, claims highest minimum wages in India
113.article_body: Delhi government on Friday raised the dearness allowance (DA) for labourers amid rising inflation. With this, the monthly wages for unskilled labourers have been raised from ₹16,064 to ₹16,506 and semi-skilled labourers' wages have been increased from ₹17,693 to ₹18,187 per month. "Minimum wages in Delhi are highest in comparison to any other state," Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia claimed.

114.title: Part of hill falls on J&K highway near tunnel collapse site, video surfaces
114.article_body: A day after an under-construction tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district collapsed, a part of a nearby hill caved in on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway on Friday. The incident took place in the Makerkote area and a video of the same has also surfaced. One labourer has died while around nine others are still feared trapped in the tunnel.

115.title: Rishi Sunak, wife Akshata enter 'UK Rich List' with combined £730 million wealth
115.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife Akshata Murty have been included in The Sunday Times Rich List of the UK's wealthiest 250 people for the first time. The couple has ranked 222nd in the list with a combined fortune of £730 million. Akshata Murty, the daughter of Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, owns about 0.9% stake in Infosys.

116.title: Committed to ensuring security of Chinese nationals in Pak: PM
116.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif said that his government is committed to providing the highest level of security to all Chinese institutions and nationals working in Pakistan. Sharif made the remarks in a statement issued after his meeting with a Chinese delegation led by External Security Commissioner Cheng Guoping. Notably, a terror attack in Karachi last month killed three Chinese teachers.

117.title: WHO calls for emergency meet amid rise in monkeypox cases: Report
117.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has called for an emergency meeting to discuss the rapidly growing monkeypox outbreak, British publication The Telegraph said on Friday. This comes hours after France, Germany and Belgium confirmed their first cases. Other countries that have detected monkeypox cases include the UK, US, Portugal, Sweden, Spain and Italy.

118.title: I will play in IPL 2023, it'll be unfair to not play in Chennai & say 'Thank you': MSD
118.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni has said that he will "definitely" play in IPL 2023, adding, "It's a simple reason. It will be unfair to not play in Chennai and say 'Thank you'." He added, "Hopefully next year it'll be an opportunity where the teams will be travelling so it will be like a thank you to all the different venues."

119.title: Matthew Wade reprimanded for angrily throwing helmet and bat in dressing room
119.article_body: GT's Matthew Wade has been reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's match against RCB at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Wade was seen angrily throwing his helmet and bat in the dressing room following his dismissal following a review for LBW. Wade has accepted the sanction, the IPL said.

120.title: I've forgiven everyone who hurt me: Indrani after being released from jail
120.article_body: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea was released from a Mumbai jail on Friday, almost seven years after being arrested in her daughter Sheena Bora's murder case in 2015. "I am very happy," said Mukerjea while leaving Byculla Jail, adding, "Empathy and forgiveness...I have forgiven all the people who have hurt me." She said she has learned "a lot" in jail.

121.title: Ancient vase kept in kitchen in UK sells for ₹14 crore, pic surfaces
121.article_body: A rare 18th century Chinese vase bought in 1980s for a few hundred pounds has been auctioned for almost £1.5 million (over ₹14 crore). It was purchased by a surgeon and passed from the original owner to his son, who, not realising its true value positioned it in his kitchen. Its value was revealed when an antiques specialist spotted it.

122.title: Shastri's photoshoot pics go viral, says 'Family lives in Mumbai, I live in the moment'
122.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to share pictures from a photoshoot, which later went viral with fans turning his posts into memes. Shastri captioned one of his pictures, "My family lives in Mumbai and I live in the moment." "Good mornings are optional if you haven't slept at all," he wrote alongside another picture.

123.title: It's in illegally-occupied area: Govt on reports of 2nd Chinese bridge on Pangong
123.article_body: The government has issued a statement on reports of a second Chinese bridge being constructed across the Pangong Lake in Ladakh by China. "Both these bridges are in areas that have continued to be under illegal occupation of China since the 1960s," said the government. "We've never accepted such illegal occupation of our territory," it added.

124.title: Vendors caught littering leftover flowers fined: Hyderabad Mayor
124.article_body: The Mayor of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation said that vendors and other persons were fined after they were caught littering leftover flowers, despite repeated notices served to them. Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal added that the intention behind this was to keep the surroundings tidy. "Swachh Survekshan is everyone's social responsibility," she tweeted.

125.title: Nepal reports its first cases of African swine fever
125.article_body: Nepal has reported its first cases of African swine fever, the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) said on Thursday. The fever has so far killed 934 pigs in six municipalities in Kathmandu Valley, according to a OIE report. The country has 1,426 susceptible and 1,364 active cases of the fever as of Thursday evening, the report said.

126.title: CSK to bat first against RR in their last IPL 2022 match, Rayudu returns to playing XI
126.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bat first against RR in their last IPL 2022 match on Friday. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Ambati Rayudu returns to the playing XI for CSK in place of Shivam Dube, while Shimron Hetmyer has replaced Jimmy Neesham in RR's playing XI.

127.title: Oscar-winning Greek composer Vangelis dies at the age of 79
127.article_body: Greek composer Vangelis, who won Oscars for the music of 'Chariots of Fire' and 'Blade Runner', died aged 79 on Tuesday. As per reports, Vangelis died in a hospital in France where he was being treated for COVID-19. The composer had homes in London, Paris and Athens. Vangelis was self-taught in music and claimed he never learnt to read notes.

128.title: Gyanesh Bharti appointed as Commissioner of Unified MCD
128.article_body: The Home Affairs Ministry has announced that 1998 batch IAS officer Gyanesh Bharti has been appointed as the Commissioner of the Unified Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Meanwhile, Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as the Special Officer in the Unified MCD. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22.

129.title: Man killed with an axe in Palghar, accused arrested
129.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-old man identified as Sainath Jadhav was killed with an axe at Nalasopara in Maharashtra's Palghar in the early hours of Friday. The victim was killed by 18-year-old Roopesh Thackeray when Jadhav tried to rescue his relative from being attacked, the police added. The accused was later arrested by Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police.

130.title: Massive fire at godown in Delhi's Jhandewalan, 27 tenders reach spot
130.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a godown in the Jhandewalan area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 27 fire tenders reached the spot and the blaze was brought under control. Informing about the same, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain said that no injuries or casualties were reported in the fire, which reportedly broke out at around 2.05 pm.

131.title: Pune civic body to set up centralised command centre for civic issues
131.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is setting up Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) to address all civic grievances. The ICCC will also act as a centre to monitor disaster management and traffic movement, according to a report. "It would be citizen oriented and enable quick response to citizens' concerns," Deputy Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Patil said.

132.title: 2 held for extorting ₹18,000 by posing as policemen in Bhayandar
132.article_body: Two men who posed as policemen and extorted ₹18,000 from a grocer were arrested by Bhayandar Police. The incident occurred on May 3 when the victim was on his way to deliver goods and was stopped by the duo, who accused him of selling banned gutka. They then snatched the money from him and fled.

133.title: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea rejected
133.article_body: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea in connection with a money laundering case filed by Enforcement Directorate was rejected by a special court. Through his lawyer, Sachin Waze sought bail, saying he was not arrested during the probe and keeping him in custody was unnecessary. ED prosecutor said other crimes registered against Waze should be considered.

134.title: I request Sehwag to be mindful while making such statements: Akhtar on 'chucking' remark
134.article_body: After Virender Sehwag stated Shoaib Akhtar used to chuck while bowling, the ex-Pakistan pacer said, "I'd request Sehwag to not pass such comments. If Sehwag knows more than ICC...he's entitled to his opinion." He added, "Cricketers should make sure their statements don't disturb...harmony between India & Pakistan. I request Sehwag to be mindful while making such statements in...social media age."

135.title: India's annual FDI inflow hits all-time high of $83.57 billion in 2021-22
135.article_body: India's annual FDI (foreign direct investment) inflow hit an all-time high of $83.57 billion in the financial year 2021-22, the Ministry of Commerce & Industry said on Friday. The Ministry said that the highest-ever annual FDI inflow has been recorded despite military operation in Ukraine and COVID-19 pandemic. In 2020-21, the FDI inflow in India stood at $81.97 billion.

136.title: Depp was controlling, said I got a scratch from sex with another person: Ex-girlfriend
136.article_body: Johnny Depp was jealous, controlling and frequently drunk, his ex-girlfriend, actress Ellen Barkin, said in testimony. "I had a scratch on my back once that got him very, very angry because he insisted it came from me having sex with a person who wasn't him," she added. Barkin said she had a brief "sexual relationship" with Depp in the 1990s.

137.title: 16 pvt schools to shut in GB Nagar for operating without recognition
137.article_body: GB Nagar's education department released list of 16 private schools which were running without recognition certificates in the district and directed for their closure with immediate effect. The private schools that have been found violating the rules are located at Garhi Chaukhandi, Mamura, Raipur Bangar, Maincha, Nangla Nainsukh, Salarpur, Madalpur, Jhajhar Road, Bhaipur Brahmanan and Wajidpur.

138.title: Jet Airways gets DGCA nod to resume flight operations after 3 years
138.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has granted the air operator's certificate (AOC) to Jet Airways, allowing the grounded carrier to resume commercial flight operations after three years. The airline successfully conducted all its proving flights, reportedly with DGCA officials onboard, this week. Earlier, the Ministry of Home Affairs had granted security clearance to Jet Airways.

139.title: ₹25,000 monthly salary is among top 10% incomes earned in India: Report
139.article_body: A monthly salary of ₹25,000 is among the top 10% of incomes earned in India, The State of Inequality Report released by the Economic Advisory Council to the PM (EAC-PM) has said. Citing the 2018-19 and 2019-20 data from the Periodic Labour Force Survey, the report said nearly 15% of the working population earned less than ₹5,000 per month.

140.title: Got bruises on arms, legs shooting 'Designer': Divya Khosla Kumar
140.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Divya Khosla Kumar, who was seen in 'Designer' with Guru Randhawa and Yo Yo Honey Singh, said that she got bruises on her arms and legs while shooting. "There was one outfit...made out of...metal. Along with that...I had inches long nail extensions...I couldn't sit during the shoot because of my outfit! It was a...shoot of seven hours," she added.

141.title: HC orders company to pay ₹10 lakh to terminated employee in B'luru
141.article_body: Karnataka HC has directed a Bengaluru-based company to pay a ₹10 lakh compensation to the employee who was terminated after he declined to undergo a performance improvement program. Since the employee was terminated without holding an enquiry, he's eligible for compensation, it said. However, it didn't allow his reinstatement to the job due to loss of mutual trust with employer.

142.title: Seema drops 'Khan' surname after filing for divorce from Sohail
142.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema has dropped the 'Khan' surname from her social media accounts and returned to her maiden name Seema Kiran Sajdeh. This comes a week after she filed for divorce from actor-filmmaker Sohail Khan after 24 years of marriage. Rumours about their separation began when the couple was shown as living separately on the show.

143.title: Amazon, Flipkart in talks to buy stake in $1.1 bn Metropolis Healthcare: Report
143.article_body: Diagnostics chain Metropolis Healthcare is reportedly looking to raise over $300 million and bring onboard a strategic partner by selling a significant minority stake. While Flipkart and Apollo Hospitals are among potential investors, Amazon has held preliminary discussions, Bloomberg reported. Metropolis currently has a market value of $1.1 billion, about half of what it was at the start of 2022.

144.title: Dave Chappelle's attacker charged with attempted murder in separate case
144.article_body: Isaiah Lee, who attacked comedian Dave Chappelle onstage during a performance with a replica gun and knife, has been charged with attempted murder in a separate case. The 23-year-old allegedly stabbed his roommate during a fight at a transitional housing apartment in December last year, police said. Police added that publicity from Dave Chappelle's attack helped them solve this case.

145.title: 18-year-old girl dies as her burqa gets stuck in bike wheel in Hyd
145.article_body: An 18-year-old girl fell from a motorcycle after her burqa got stuck in the motorcycle's rear wheel in Hyderabad. She received major injuries and succumbed to death, while her brother, who was driving the motorcycle, survived the accident with no injuries. Sharing a video of the accident, TSRTC MD, VC Sajjanar, tweeted, "Women...be careful when you sit on a bike."

146.title: SC lifts stay on Delhi HC order on right to feed stray dogs
146.article_body: Supreme Court has vacated a stay on the Delhi High Court order, which said that "stray dogs have the right to food and citizens have the right to feed them". The verdict comes as a relief to animal welfare organisations involved in feeding stray dogs. The Supreme Court had put the stay on the HC order on an NGO's plea.

147.title: Rachakonda Police conduct awareness programme for poultry workers
147.article_body: She Teams of Rachakonda Police conducted an awareness programme in Vanasthalipuram regarding cybercrimes, human trafficking, gender sensitisation, child marriage, child labour and child abuse. The awareness programme was conducted for poultry farm workers of the locality, who were asked to dial 100 if they came across such incidents. The Rachakonda Police tweeted about the awareness programme.

148.title: Pune's SPPU prepares development plan for Sindhudurg district
148.article_body: Eighteen departments of Pune's Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) have prepared a development report for Sindhudurg district. "We have chosen this district considering...climate change and the need for infrastructure," the project's coordinator said. Notably, the report highlights road connectivity as a major challenge and recommends building of cold storage facilities to promote aquaculture.

149.title: Happy that people have accepted the choices I made: Kartik Aaryan
149.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, while talking about choosing a particular role or a film, said he is happy that people have accepted the choices he made till date. "It's the energy that people are catching up on," he said. Further, while talking about breaking his image of a monologue boy from 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', Kartik said that he made conscious decisions.

150.title: Margot Robbie to star in 'Ocean's Eleven' prequel movie: Reports
150.article_body: Margot Robbie is set to play the lead role in a prequel to the crime drama film 'Ocean's Eleven', according to reports. Jay Roach, who previously worked with Robbie in film 'Bombshell', has been roped in to direct the forthcoming project, reports stated. 'Ocean's Eleven', which was released in 2001, featured Brad Pitt, George Clooney and Julia Roberts, among others.

151.title: Ketan Mehta, Anubhav Sinha team up for film on freedom fighter Usha Mehta
151.article_body: Filmmakers Ketan Mehta and Anubhav Sinha have teamed up for 'Freedom Radio', an upcoming film based on the life of freedom fighter Usha Mehta. It'll be helmed by Ketan, while Anubhav will be producing it under his production banner Benaras Mediaworks. Usha Mehta started a radio station, Secret Congress Radio, during the Quit India Movement in 1942.

152.title: MP man arrested for making 7,000 fake Aadhaar cards in Hyderabad
152.article_body: Officials said that a man who had fled after making over 7,000 fake Aadhaar cards in Hyderabad, was arrested by the police's Cyber Cell in Indore. Police said that the accused, Pawan Kotiya, who had two cases registered against him, was handed over to the Hyderabad Police. His eight aides were arrested by Hyderabad Police a few days ago.

153.title: She's a far-left actor: Musk on friend of air hostess who accused him of sexual harassment
153.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the friend of the flight attendant who has accused him of sexual harassment "is a far-left activist/actress in LA with a major political axe to grind." In a report, the flight attendant's friend accused Musk of exposing himself and offering to buy a horse for her friend in exchange for an erotic massage in 2016.

154.title: CSK made a lot of mistakes, captaincy issue created lot of confusion: Akhtar
154.article_body: Talking about CSK, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "They have made a lot of mistakes and their dressing room never looked intact in IPL 2022." "The captaincy issue created a lot of confusion," added Akhtar. "CSK's management didn't look serious about IPL 2022. If MS Dhoni leaves they are left with nothing," he had earlier stated.

155.title: Nearly 2,000 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol have surrendered: Russia
155.article_body: Nearly 2,000 soldiers holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, the last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered to Russian forces so far, Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said. Those who have surrendered have been taken to Russian-controlled areas. Ukraine, which is aiming to secure a prisoner swap, said efforts are on to evacuate the remaining defenders.

156.title: Rapper Lil Nas X to be honoured with 2022 Hal David Starlight Award
156.article_body: Rapper Lil Nas X will be honoured with Hal David Starlight Award at the 2022 Songwriters Hall of Fame ceremony. The award recognises young songwriters making significant impact in the music industry through their original songs. At the age of 23, Lil Nas X will become one of the youngest recipients of the award after Taylor Swift and Nick Jonas.

157.title: Nigerian man arrested with 400 gram of MDMA worth ₹60 lakh in Mumbai
157.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Mumbai's Bandra arrested a Nigerian man from Goregaon and recovered 400 gram of MDMA from his possession. According to Datta Nalawade, DCP, Anti-Narcotics Cell, the seized drug is worth ₹60 lakh in the international market. Earlier in April, another Nigerian national was arrested in Mumbai with 750 gram MDMA worth ₹1.12 crore.

158.title: Sexual harassment story meant to interfere with Twitter acquisition: Musk
158.article_body: After a report claimed Tesla CEO Elon Musk allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant employed by SpaceX in 2016, he said that the story was meant to "interfere with the Twitter acquisition". Responding to a follower who asked if he responded to the writers of the story, Musk replied, "The story was written before they even talked to me."

159.title: Trolling part of life: Dalip on Big B, Akshay's trolling over pan masala
159.article_body: Veteran actor Dalip Tahil has reacted to Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar being trolled over endorsing pan masala brands, saying that trolling is a part of life. "If you don't want to be trolled, don't go on social media," the actor added. Dalip further said that trolling is also publicity for some actors who were not recognised before social media.

160.title: Poonam Dhillon's daughter Paloma to debut opposite Sunny Deol's son Rajveer
160.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon's daughter Paloma Thakeria is set to make her Bollywood debut opposite Rajveer Deol, the younger son of actor Sunny Deol, in Rajshri Productions' upcoming project. It will also mark filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya's son Avnish Barjatya's debut as a director. The yet-untitled film is reportedly set against the backdrop of a lavish destination wedding.

161.title: There's not a lot that has gone my way in IPL 2022: RCB's Maxwell
161.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said there is not a lot that has gone his way in IPL 2022, having scored 268 runs so far in the ongoing edition. "To be able to influence the game in different areas of the contest is what I try to do," added Maxwell. The all-rounder has scored one half-century till now in IPL 2022.

162.title: Kept searching for fours despite a close shave: Harbhajan on Kohli's 73 vs GT
162.article_body: Discussing RCB batter Virat Kohli's 73 off 54 balls against GT, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said, "Kohli fought...and in an interesting fashion." "There was a close shave...a catch was dropped in the deep but that didn't stop his attitude. He kept on searching [for] fours, the day he searches [for] fours Kohli's attitude is like this, attacking mode," added Harbhajan.

163.title: He's been going to temples for yrs: Man who was booked for taking pet dog to Kedarnath
163.article_body: A Noida man booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by making his pet dog touch an idol at the Kedarnath shrine said he's been taking his pet dog to temples for the past four years. "Why is this drama happening now suddenly?" said Vikash Tyagi on Instagram. He also shared an old video of his dog at Badrinath and Tungnath.

164.title: Archer ruled out of English summer 2022 after suffering back stress fracture
164.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer has been ruled out of this year's English summer due to a lower back stress fracture. The England and Wales Cricket Board confirmed that the 27-year-old pacer will not be available to play until the end of September at the earliest. However, no timeframe has been set for Archer's return, ECB said.

165.title: 3 held for assaulting man on suspicion of theft in Gwalior
165.article_body: Three persons were held for allegedly thrashing a man on suspicion of theft in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. A video had surfaced where the accused had tied the victim, covered his eyes and assaulted him in the Falka Bazaar area, Gwalior SP Amit Sanghi said. Notably, the arrests were made after the police questioned some people from the area.

166.title: Kangana Ranaut buys Mercedes Maybach worth over ₹3 crore, pic surfaces
166.article_body: Kangana Ranaut on Thursday attended the premiere of her upcoming film 'Dhaakad' and unveiled her latest purchase, the Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore. Pictures and videos of Kangana unveiling her new car have been shared online. A video shows Kangana clapping as two people removed the cover of the car.

167.title: Soni Razdan joins the cast of 'Brown' alongside Karisma Kapoor, Helen
167.article_body: Actress Soni Razdan has joined the cast of Abhinay Deo's upcoming film 'Brown'. The film also stars Karisma Kapoor and Helen in key roles. "An eclectic set of characters are part of...story. I was [compelled] to come out of my comfort zone," Soni said. Produced by Zee Studios, 'Brown' is a neo-noir crime drama set in the city of Kolkata.

168.title: Student molested inside coffee shop in JNU campus, probe underway
168.article_body: A female student was allegedly molested inside the coffee shop of the Jawaharlal Nehru University campus in Delhi. The complainant alleged that the accused asked her whether both of them can stay together before he started "performing sexual act" on her. Notably, police have launched the probe and the FIR has been lodged under IPC Sections 354 and 354-B.

169.title: Navjot Sidhu surrenders at Patiala court after getting 1-year jail term
169.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was sentenced to one year in jail for a 1988 road rage incident that killed a man, has surrendered before Chief Judicial Magistrate in Punjab's Patiala. "He is under judicial custody. Medical examination and other legal procedures will be adopted," said Sidhu's media advisor Surinder Dalla. He had earlier requested time to surrender on medical grounds.

170.title: My sons used to ask, 'Why's papa home, doesn't go to work?': Bobby
170.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has said in an interview that he took a break from acting after welcoming his sons Aryaman and Dharam in 2001 and 2004, respectively. The actor added, "(They would ask) 'Why is papa home? Why doesn't he go to work?' And when I heard them say that, I didn't want to set a bad example for them."

171.title: Thailand to lift curbs on nightlife from June as COVID cases decline
171.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases, Thailand has said that it will allow entertainment venues, pubs, karaoke bars and massage parlours to remain open until midnight from June. "These businesses should take a universal prevention approach...staff must have received booster doses and take antigen tests every seven days," Taweesin Visanuyothin, a spokesman for the government's COVID-19 taskforce, said.

172.title: 8 task forces to be set up to monitor developmental work in B'luru
172.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that eight task forces will be constituted for all the zones in Bengaluru to monitor developmental work. He said the task forces will be headed by a minister, while MLAs, MLCs and MPs will be its members. They'll have powers to take decisions whenever there's any emergency like heavy rains and floods, Bommai added.

173.title: Prepping for radiotherapy, I'm a bundle of nerves: Chhavi Mittal
173.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, has shared a post talking about prepping for radiotherapy. She wrote, "I won't deny I'm a bundle of nerves. Not for the prep but for the cycles to begin from Monday." The actress further wrote that her immunity is at an all-time low.

174.title: 17-yr-old boy rapes, impregnates 13-yr-old sister in Hyderabad; arrested
174.article_body: Police arrested a 17-year-old boy for allegedly raping his 13-year-old sister and impregnating her in Hyderabad's Bachupally. The matter came to light when the girl told her mother about missing her periods. She took her to a doctor who found she was 18 weeks pregnant. She later revealed that her brother had been sexually assaulting her for past two years.

175.title: A director called me after seeing Dhaakad poster & asked 'Is that you?': Divya
175.article_body: Divya Dutta, speaking about her latest film 'Dhaakad', said, "After the posters were released the biggest director called...and said 'Is that you? Oh my god!
