You're unrecognisable'." "It's so amazing for an actor to hear something like this," said Divya, who is playing an antagonist in the film. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, it also stars Kangana Ranaut and Arjun Rampal.

176.title: Supreme Court transfers Gyanvapi Mosque case to higher court in UP
176.article_body: The Gyanvapi Mosque case will be heard by a higher court in UP, the Supreme Court ordered on Friday. The case has been transferred from Civil Judge (senior division), Varanasi to District Judge, Varanasi. A senior and experienced judicial officer of UP Judicial services will hear the case, the apex court said. It's hearing a plea challenging mosque's video survey.

177.title: Death toll due to landslides in Arunachal Pradesh rises to 8
177.article_body: The death toll due to landslides in Arunachal Pradesh amid heavy rains has increased to eight, police said. This comes after a 35-year-old woman's body was retrieved from the debris in the backside of a 'dhaba' in Itanagar after six days of a search operation. Three people died due to landslides in Kurung Kumey while another is still missing.

178.title: Meta planning to launch crypto-supported payments platform: Filings
178.article_body: Meta is planning to launch a payments platform with support for cryptocurrency, trademark filings revealed. Meta filed five applications in the US for a new platform called 'Meta Pay'. The applications seek licenses to operate as an "online social networking service" for investors allowing financial trades and exchange of digital currency, virtual currency and cryptocurrency, among other things.

179.title: 6 proxy candidates appear for CISF exam in Chhattisgarh, arrested
179.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police have busted a racket and arrested six people who were appearing as proxy candidates during the physical test of CISF recruitment exam in Durg. The gang was busted due to a "mismatch" of biometrics and "many more are likely to be arrested", district SP Abhishek Pallava said. Each candidate paid ₹5 lakh to clear the exam, he added.

180.title: 27-year-old NEET PG candidate dies by suicide ahead of exam in TN
180.article_body: A 27-year-old female doctor allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday, ahead of the NEET PG 2022 exam. The deceased had got married six months ago and was studying for the exam at her mother's house. The incident occurred after some of the woman's family members, including her mother, reportedly refused to let her skip the exam.

181.title: No ED summons yet, will cooperate in investigation: Raj Kundra's lawyer
181.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra's lawyer has stated that he has not received any summons or communication from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) yet. The ED has registered a money laundering case against Kundra in connection with the production and circulation of pornography films. Kundra's lawyer further stated that it is Kundra's duty to cooperate with the investigation conducted by the ED.

182.title: Hardik Patel's exit from Congress ungraceful: Jignesh Mevani
182.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani criticised Hardik Patel for resigning from Congress and said that his exit from the party was ungraceful as Congress party gave all the support to him. "You can have differences with the party. But it is inappropriate (for Patel) to say that the Congress is anti-Gujarat or anti-India," Mevani said. Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday.

183.title: 3 Raj policemen injured as drunk wedding guests throw stones at them
183.article_body: A police sub-inspector and two constables were injured when some drunk guests at a wedding allegedly threw stones at them following a scuffle in Rajasthan's Kota, police said. As many as eight persons, including two women, have been detained, police added. They have been detained on charges of rioting and attack on a public servant, police further said.

184.title: Sensex jumps over 1,500 points to end at 54,326, Nifty closes above 16,250
184.article_body: The Sensex jumped 1,534 points or 2.91% to close at 54,326, while the broader Nifty climbed 456 points to settle above 16,250 on Friday. The benchmark indices rallied as Asian stocks jumped after China cut a key lending benchmark to support a slowing economy. All sectoral indices ended in the green with metal, pharma, and realty indices up 3-4% each.

185.title: Madhavan's 'Rocketry...' gets standing ovation at Cannes, video surfaces
185.article_body: R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' received a standing ovation during its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival on Thursday, a video of which has also surfaced. Following the film's premiere, Madhavan, who has directed and produced the film in addition to acting in it, said, "We couldn't have asked for...better stage to showcase this film. Thank you...very much."

186.title: Top US, Russian generals talk for 1st time since start of Ukraine war
186.article_body: Russia's Chief of General Staff Valery Gerasimov and US Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman General Mark Milley spoke for the first time since the start of the invasion of Ukraine. They "discussed several security-related issues of concern", a US spokesperson said. Notably, this comes a few days after US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke to Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu.

187.title: Had we come a year earlier in Goa, we might have done wonders: Azad
187.article_body: The Goa TMC announced an ad-hoc core committee of eight members on Thursday and during the announcement TMC Goa in-charge Kirti Azad said, "We are grateful to the people for allowing us to garner over 5 percent vote share." "Had we come a year earlier, we might have done wonders here. But then this is what it is," Azad added.

188.title: Man thrown 50 feet away as speeding bike hits him in Pune
188.article_body: An elderly man died on the spot after a speeding two-wheeler hit him on the Pune-Morgaon highway in Baramati on Sunday, according to a report. The man was reportedly crossing the road when the bike hit him, throwing him 50 feet away. Meanwhile, the driver of the two-wheeler has been arrested and a police case has been registered against him.

189.title: Selective leaks of Gyanvapi Mosque survey report must stop: Supreme Court
189.article_body: While hearing the Gyanvapi Mosque committee's plea challenging the court-ordered survey, the Supreme Court said that "selective leaks" of the survey commission's report must stop. Only the judge must open the report, the apex court said. Varanasi court had earlier removed Advocate Commissioner Ajay Kumar Mishra from the survey team for leaking information to the media through a private cameraman.

190.title: Describe any scars, tattoos not known: Musk on claims of 'exposing genitals' to air hostess
190.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to respond to allegations that he allegedly exposed his genitals to a flight attendant in 2016. He tweeted, "I've a challenge to this liar who claims their friend saw me "exposed"...describe just one thing, anything...(scars, tattoos) that isn’t known by the public. She won't be able to do so, because it never happened."

191.title: He's been going to temples for 4 yrs: Man booked for taking pet dog to Kedarnath
191.article_body: A Noida man booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by making his pet dog touch an idol at the Kedarnath shrine said he's been taking his pet dog to temples for the past four years. "Why is this drama happening now suddenly?" said Vikash Tyagi on Instagram. He also shared an old video of his dog at Badrinath and Tungnath.

192.title: It's 'golden era' for women actors, we're getting better roles: Madhuri
192.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit, in a recent interview, said it is a golden era for women actors as they're getting better roles these days. "Earlier, if you wanted to make something women-centric, it would be the same old trope, where you're either an avenging angel or...victim," she said. Today, women characters have their own flaws which make them good, Madhuri added.

193.title: Lalu Yadav, his family a symbol of corruption in Bihar: Sushil Modi
193.article_body: After CBI filed a 'land for railway job scam' case against Lalu Yadav, BJP leader Sushil Modi called Yadav and his family a symbol of corruption in Bihar. Modi claimed, "The modus operandi was...you give me land...I'll give [you] a Group D job in Railways. Here...land was first granted in someone else's name...after five-six years it was gifted to Yadav."

194.title: Russia to consider allowing citizens over 40 to join military
194.article_body: Amid the Ukraine war, the Russian Parliament said it'd consider a bill to allow Russians over 40 years of age and foreigners over 30 to join the military. This would enable the military to utilise the skills of older professionals, it added. Currently, only Russians aged 18-40 and foreigners aged 18-30 can enter into a first contract with the military.

195.title: Players start having doubts after a bad patch like that: Hesson on Kohli
195.article_body: After RCB batter Virat Kohli scored 73(54) against Gujarat Titans on Thursday, RCB Director of Cricket Mike Hesson commented on Kohli's "bad patch" in this IPL season. "When you go through a (bad) patch like that...he is only human...you do start to just have doubts...a little bit of luck tonight but he's certainly earned it," Hesson said.

196.title: Kante is Chelsea's Neymar, Mbappe, Salah, De Bruyne, Van Dijk: Tuchel
196.article_body: Talking about midfielder N'Golo Kante, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said, "He is our Mohamed Salah...our Virgil van Dijk...our Kevin De Bruyne...our Neymar Jr...our Kylian Mbappé." "Kante has played only 40% of the games so it is...a miracle that we...[are] third...[on the Premier League points table]," added Tuchel. "If you...have Kante 40% of the time it's a huge problem," stated Tuchel.

197.title: Always my dream to trend on Twitter: World Boxing C'ships gold medallist Nikhat
197.article_body: After winning the gold medal at Women's World Boxing Championships 2022, Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen said, "It was always my dream to...trend on Twitter and to achieve something for India at the world level is the biggest motivation." "The last two years were really difficult...as we couldn't train due to COVID-19," added Nikhat. Nikhat termed her parents as her inspiration.

198.title: RBI to transfer ₹30,307 crore as surplus to central government for 2021-22
198.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) board has approved the transfer of ₹30,307 crore as surplus to the central government for the accounting year 2021-22. It has further decided to maintain the Contingency Risk Buffer at 5.50%. The central bank's board also reviewed the current economic situation, global and domestic challenges and the impact of recent geopolitical developments.

199.title: BJP is using him: Raut on Raj Thackeray's postponed Ayodhya visit
199.article_body: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray postponed his proposed visit to Ayodhya, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut alleged that the "BJP is using the MNS chief" for political gain. Raut said, "I got to know from the media that...(MNS) cancelled some programs in Ayodhya. We would have supported them (MNS)...After all, there's a huge section of Shiv Sena supporters in Ayodhya."

200.title: 40-year-old woman killed by wild elephants in MP's Shahdol
200.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was killed in a late-night attack by a herd of wild elephants in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district. The deceased, identified as Draupati Singh, and her husband (48) were sleeping outside their under-construction house when the elephants came in from the neighbouring state of Chhattisgarh and attacked them, forest officials said.

201.title: 4 men assault, rob commuter at Virar railway station in Mumbai; 2 arrested
201.article_body: A 37-year-old commuter was reportedly assaulted and robbed by four co-passengers at Mumbai's Virar railway station on Sunday. One of the accused started beating him up when the man entered the escalator. Once they reached the top, other accused hit him, snatched his gold chain and mobile and fled away. Based on CCTV footage, Railway Police arrested two of them.

202.title: Meme compares Jacqueline and Sona, singer tells trolls 'Stop degrading her'
202.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra reacted to a meme comparing Jacqueline Fernandez and her as 'Expectation vs reality'. "I'm not available on 'order' thankfully...Not on sale. My earlier tweet on her asked for youngsters not to be too. Stop making a...fool of yourself," she tweeted. Sona earlier shared she won't buy products endorsed by Jacqueline due to her ongoing involvement with ED.

203.title: US' economic growth poised to outpace China's for first time since 1976: Report
203.article_body: The economic growth of United States is poised to outpace China's for the first time this year since 1976, Bloomberg Economics wrote in a report. China, the world's second-largest economy, will grow just 2% in 2022 due to its Zero Covid policy, Bloomberg Economics reported. On the other hand, the US' gross domestic product (GDP) will increase 2.8%, it added.

204.title: I hit Johnny Depp many times, it was self-defence: Amber Heard
204.article_body: Actress Amber Heard, testifying in the ongoing defamation trial against her, admitted to hitting her ex-husband Johnny Depp "many times" to "defend herself". She added, "[I did it] if it meant I could get away...or the difference between a sore face and a broken nose." Depp is suing Heard over her 2018 op-ed claiming to be a domestic abuse survivor.

205.title: SC permits firms to export excavated iron ore from Karnataka mines
205.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday permitted mining firms to export their excavated iron ore from mines of Karnataka's Ballari, Chitradurga and Tumakuru. "Permission granted to the applicant to export iron ore...to countries abroad but in terms of Government of India policies," SC said. SC was hearing pleas of mining firms seeking the lifting of curbs on iron ore sale and export.

206.title: Cong's 'Chintan Shivir' failed to achieve anything meaningful: Kishor
206.article_body: Election strategist Prashant Kishor said that Congress' 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur only helped in "prolonging the status-quo" and "it failed to achieve anything meaningful". Earlier, Kishor was in talks with the Congress leadership to work for the revival of the party but later he declined the offer saying, "I couldn't have added anything to Congress."

207.title: Dolphins use coral as medicine to treat skin ailments: Study
207.article_body: According to a study, bottlenose dolphins may be self-medicating their skin ailments by rubbing themselves against coral reefs. Corals were found to contain bioactive metabolites with antibacterial, antioxidative and oestrogen-like hormonal properties, which could be helpful in skin treatments. Dolphins are prone to yeast, bacterial and viral pox infections exacerbated by global warming.

208.title: Businessman arrested for bogus ITC claim of over ₹7 crore in Pune
208.article_body: Maharashtra government's GST Department has arrested a Pune-based businessman, Pravin Gundecha, for an alleged bogus Input Tax Credit (ITC) claim of over ₹7 crore. "Gundecha procured bogus invoices of taxable value at ₹41 crore without receiving any goods or services and thus availed wrongful ITC of ₹7.38 crore," an official release said. He has been remanded to 14-day judicial custody.

209.title: Electricity official seeks ₹5,000 bribe to replace pole in Pune; held
209.article_body: A 57-year-old executive engineer of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) has been arrested after he allegedly demanded a ₹5,000 bribe for replacing an electricity pole in Pune. The district unit of the state Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) filed a case after confirming that the accused had taken a reduced bribe of ₹3,000 after the initial demand.

210.title: Adivi Sesh reacts to Major's clash with Akshay's Prithviraj & Haasan's Vikram
210.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh opened up about the box-office clash between his upcoming film 'Major', Akshay Kumar-starrer film 'Prithviraj' and Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram'. "Practically, Major is the biggest film in Telugu. Vikram is the biggest film in Tamil and Prithviraj is the biggest film in Hindi. But, while there are big fishes in the sea, we're the goldfish," Adivi said.

211.title: China opposes Canada's plans to ban Huawei, ZTE from 5G network
211.article_body: China has said it is opposed to Canada's plans to ban the use of 5G equipment from China's Huawei and ZTE to protect national security. China said it will take all necessary measures to "safeguard the legitimate interests of Chinese firms". China's embassy in Canada said the alleged security concerns were a "pretext for political manipulation".

212.title: Now actresses don't innovate enough, they look the same: Asha Parekh
212.article_body: Veteran actress Asha Parekh has stated that actresses nowadays don't innovate enough. She added, "If they even dressed up differently from others, they would not all look the same." The actress further said there is too much exposure of actors due to social media. "If you're not seen much in public, people are inquisitive to know about you," she added.

213.title: Biden arrives in South Korea on his first trip to Asia as Prez
213.article_body: US President Joe Biden arrived in South Korea on Friday on his first trip to Asia after taking office. Biden will meet South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol at a Samsung Electronics plant, the first meeting between the two leaders. On Sunday, Biden will arrive in Japan, where he will meet PM Narendra Modi on the sidelines of Quad summit.

214.title: Canadian MP Chandra Arya speaks in Kannada in Canadian Parliament, video viral
214.article_body: Canada's Indian-origin MP Chandra Arya spoke in his mother tongue Kannada in the Canadian Parliament on Thursday and shared a video that has since gone viral. "This is the first time Kannada is spoken in any parliament...outside India," said Arya. He quoted lines from a poem, which translated to 'wherever you are, however you are, be a Kannadiga forever'.

215.title: PM must defend nation: Rahul on China building bridge in Ladakh
215.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday reacted to reports of China building a second bridge on Pangong Tso lake in Ladakh, saying, "India's national security and territorial integrity [are] non-negotiable...[PM Narendra Modi] must defend the nation." This comes after Ministry of External Affairs said that it's "closely" monitoring the situation. "A timid and docile response won't do," Rahul added.

216.title: Payal attends 'Dhaakad' premiere, says 'Kangana wasn't happy to see me'
216.article_body: Payal Rohatgi on Thursday attended the premiere of Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad' and shared some pictures from the event on her Instagram handle. "Rangoli (Kangana's sister) you're such...good human being...But your sister wasn't happy to see me...she was sulking," she wrote. Payal, who was part of Kangana Ranaut-hosted show 'Lock Upp', recently criticised her over the way the show was conducted.

217.title: Raj Thackeray postpones Ayodhya visit amid protests by BJP leaders
217.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray on Friday took to Twitter to inform that he has temporarily postponed his proposed visit to UP's Ayodhya on June 5. The decision comes amid protests by certain BJP leaders and activists against his visit to Ayodhya. The BJP leaders were demanding Thackeray's unconditional apology for his remarks made against North Indians in 2008.

218.title: Musk offered to buy her a horse for erotic massage: Flight attendant's friend
218.article_body: In a declaration, the friend of the flight attendant who has accused Elon Musk of sexually harassing her said that he called her "for a full body massage" and exposed his genitals to her on a flight in 2016. She said he rubbed her leg and "offered to buy her a horse" if she provided him with an erotic massage.

219.title: Accused in 2019 Hyd vet's rape and murder case were deliberately killed by police: Panel
219.article_body: The Sirpurkar commission report in the 2019 Hyderabad veterinarian's murder and rape case has said that the accused were "deliberately fired upon with intent to cause death". According to police, the accused were taken to recreate the crime scene during which they allegedly tried to escape after attacking the police. Police had claimed the accused were killed in self defence.

220.title: Voyager 1 spacecraft from 1977 facing mysterious issue: NASA
220.article_body: NASA's Voyager 1 spacecraft, launched in 1977, has encountered a mysterious issue, the agency said. It said that while the probe is operating normally, the readouts from the attitude articulation and control system, which control the spacecraft's orientation in space, don't match up with what Voyager is actually doing. The issue hasn't triggered any onboard fault protection systems.

221.title: 9 new cabinet ministers take oath in Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
221.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa swore in nine new Cabinet members on Friday, among them ministers for health, trade and tourism. Earlier this month, veteran politician Ranil Wickremesinghe took over as PM to form a new cabinet after the President's elder brother, Mahinda Rajapaksa, resigned from his post over his handling of the economic crisis in the country.

222.title: N Korea claims 'good results' in COVID fight as fever cases top 2 mn
222.article_body: North Korea has said that it is achieving "good results" in its fight against its first confirmed COVID-19 outbreak. North Korea has reported over 2.24 million cases of "fever", while 65 people have died amid a nationwide outbreak of COVID-19. North Korea has not specified how many of those people with fever have been confirmed to have contracted the coronavirus.

223.title: Police raids illegal arms factory in UP's Ballia, 3 arrested
223.article_body: An illegal arms factory was busted by the police in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district. Three people have been arrested while materials used for making arms were seized from the factory, Superintendent of Police RK Nayyar said. Notably, the accused are identified as Pintu Paswan, Golu Verma and Sachin Rajbhar. However, the operation was conducted with the help of a tip-off.

224.title: Disheartening, why wasn't I there: Hina on not being invited to Cannes' India Pavilion
224.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, who walked the red carpet at Cannes Film Festival, expressed her displeasure at not being invited to the inauguration of the India Pavilion. Speaking to Film Companion, she said, "It's a bit disheartening, why was I not there?...I could've been there, probably in the audience, at least, cheering for them." Hina further said she doesn't "envy them".

225.title: 4 people stabbed & injured in 'random' attack in Norway; suspect held
225.article_body: At least four people were stabbed and injured in a "random" attack in southeast Norway on Friday, police said. One of the victims is in critical condition, officials said, adding that the suspect has been arrested. The attack comes two days after a Danish man pleaded guilty to stabbing five people to death last October in a Norwegian town.

226.title: Pratik to play Mahatma Gandhi in series based on Ramachandra Guha's books
226.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi will play the role of Mahatma Gandhi in an upcoming multi-season series. The series will be based on historian Ramachandra Guha's two books, namely, 'Gandhi Before India' and 'Gandhi: The Years that Changed the World'. "Playing the role of Mahatma is very close to my heart ever since my theatre days," Pratik said about the project.

227.title: I've been receiving threats to life, family: Bose after Zilingo fires her as CEO
227.article_body: After Singapore-based B2B fashion startup Zilingo fired Ankiti Bose as CEO, Bose said she "will pursue our rights against this witch-hunt to the full extent of the law". She also said that she has been receiving online threats to her life and family. Zilingo had earlier suspended Bose on the basis of an anonymous whistleblower complaint over alleged financial irregularities.

228.title: Tried to take pressure off Virat: Maxwell on his 40*(18) vs GT
228.article_body: After scoring 40*(18) against Gujarat Titans, RCB batter Glenn Maxwell said that he tried to "take pressure off" his partner at the other end, Virat Kohli. "I didn't want to soak up any time. If I could get those first couple (of balls) away..we can keep the momentum going...[if out on 1st ball] wouldn't have made a difference," Maxwell said.

229.title: Fantastic: PM Modi on Nikhat Zareen winning World Boxing gold medal
229.article_body: Reacting to Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen winning the gold medal in the 52-kg category at the Women's World Boxing Championships 2022, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Our boxers have made us proud! Congratulations...for a fantastic...win." "I also congratulate Manisha Moun and Parveen Hooda for their bronze medals in the same competition," he added in the tweet.

230.title: Results of Class 12 Karnataka board exams to be out in 3rd week of June: Nagesh
230.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that the results of the state's Pre-University Course exams (Class 12) will be announced in the third week of June. "The PUC exams have been successfully conducted and the valuation process will begin next week and the results will be announced in the third week of June," Nagesh said.

231.title: Aimed at spreading false propaganda: India on Pak minister's J&K remarks at UN
231.article_body: India has criticised Pakistan's Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto's remarks on J&K at the UNSC, calling them "unwarranted". Counsellor in India's Permanent Mission to the UN Rajesh Parihar said, "[The remarks] symbolise...pavlovian response aimed to misuse any forum...to propagate false, malicious propaganda against my country." 'No amount of propaganda' can deny that J&K is India's part, he added.

232.title: Kohli won't take any rest even if told to do so: Ex-selector Sarandeep
232.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli being potentially rested for Team India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa, former selector Sarandeep Singh said, "I don't think Kohli will take any rest even if someone tells him to." "I find this idea of taking rest during the national side's matches quite odd...If they want rest they can take it during IPL," added Sarandeep.

233.title: SC gave justice: Azam Khan's son on his father's bail order
233.article_body: After the Supreme Court granted interim bail to SP leader Azam Khan, his son Abdullah Azam Khan said, "Supreme Court delivered justice." "I am very happy (with SC's order). Will go to Rampur directly (after the release)," said Adeeb Azam Khan. The SC granted bail to Azam Khan two days after UP government urged the court to deny the same.

234.title: Woman, 2 kids rescued as fire breaks out in building in Delhi
234.article_body: A 28-year-old woman and her children, aged two and four, were rescued after a fire broke out in a building in Delhi's Palam Colony by police personnel. "The fire broke out on the ground floor...woman was shouting...from the roof," DCP (southwest) Manoj C said. "During the probe, it was found...fire broke out due to a short circuit," DCP added.

235.title: 9 killed as fire breaks out after tanker-truck collision in Maha's Chandrapur
235.article_body: At least nine persons were charred to death as a fire broke out after a collision between a tanker carrying diesel and a truck carrying wood in Maharashtra's Chandrapur, police said. The accident occurred on Thursday around 10.30 pm on Chandrapur-Mul Road, police added. The bodies of the victims were taken to a hospital, Chandrapur Sub-Divisional Police Officer said.

236.title: Bengaluru records its lowest min temp in May since 1945 at 17.9°C
236.article_body: Bengaluru on Friday recorded its lowest minimum temperature in the month of May since 1945 at 17.9°C, according to the India Meteorological Department data. In the May of 1945, the city had recorded the lowest minimum temperature of 16.7°C, the data showed. Earlier this week, two labourers died as the city witnessed heavy rainfall which led to flooding.

237.title: Can finally use 'Elongate' as scandal name: Musk amid sexual misconduct claims
237.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "Finally, we get to use Elongate as scandal name. It's kinda perfect." He quote-tweeted his own tweet from last year where he had suggested calling any scandal about him 'Elongate'. This comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a SpaceX flight attendant in 2016. Musk has called the claims "utterly untrue".

238.title: It was hectic: Hegde after losing her outfits, makeup before Cannes red carpet
238.article_body: Pooja Hegde has revealed that she lost all her luggage carrying her outfits, makeup and hair products before her red carpet appearance at Cannes. She said, "We couldn't cry about it because we didn't have time to do that….My team ran, they got new hair products, new makeup...I had my first meal...in the night...It was pretty hectic...We did disaster management."

239.title: Meta asks staff to not discuss abortion on internal chat due to 'increased risk'
239.article_body: A Meta executive asked employees to refrain from discussing abortion on Workplace, an internal social media platform, citing it as "an increased risk", as per a report. The top Meta executive also said abortion was "the most divisive and reported topic" by employees on Workplace. This comes after the US Supreme Court draft leak proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide.

240.title: Shashi Tharoor posts chart comparing prices of daily items in 2014 and 2022
240.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday posted a chart comparing the prices of daily commodities like rice, wheat, milk, oil, and vegetables in 2014 and 2022. "One more difference between the UPA era & the NDA: you feel it daily!" he wrote. Tharoor used #Inflation along with the chart.

241.title: Maruti to set up third Haryana plant, project to create 11,000 jobs
241.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India Limited (MSIL) will set up a new plant in Haryana's Kharkhoda which is going to be the automaker's third plant in the state. "Maruti Suzuki purchased land in Kharkhoda due to the better environment in the state," MSIL Chairman RC Bhargava said. Maruti's new project will reportedly create 11,000 jobs and will cost ₹18,000 crore.

242.title: Fix goals for 25 yrs, work consistently for people: PM Modi to BJP workers
242.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday asked the party workers to set goals for the next 25 years and continue working consistently for the country's people to fulfil their aspirations. "The people...are looking at BJP with great confidence and...hope," he said. "Every citizen wants to see...work getting done. In this backdrop, the responsibility of government increases tremendously," he added.

243.title: TikTok tests letting users play games on app in Vietnam: Report
243.article_body: TikTok has been conducting tests allowing users to play games on the app in Vietnam, Reuters reported. It could expand the gaming feature to more regions in Southeast Asia as early as third quarter. TikTok said it has tested bringing HTML5 games to its app through tie-ups with third-party game developers and studios, but didn't mention its plans for Vietnam.

244.title: Hyd Traffic Police issues advisory in view of Amberpet flyover work
244.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Thursday issued an advisory in connection with the construction of the superstructure work of the Amberpet flyover. As per the advisory, the route between Golnaka Junction to Amberpet 6 Number Junction will remain closed from May 20 till the completion of the Amberpet flyover works. The traffic police also suggested alternate routes for motorists.

245.title: High Court halts cutting of trees in Delhi till June 2
245.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday halted the cutting of trees in the national capital till June 2. "Tree felling...not permitted till the next date...to ensure that felling is done only when it is fully assured...trees would at least be transplanted," it said. HC was informed that more than 29,000 trees have been cut or transplanted in Delhi in three years.

246.title: Once co-star criticised my comedy skills, couldn't do it for a long time: Archana
246.article_body: Archana Puran Singh revealed that one of her co-stars in show 'Mr Ya Mrs' criticised her comedy skills, saying that she didn't know how to do comedy. "He felt...making certain expressions wasn't...comedy," she said, adding she couldn't do comedy for a long time after that because she used to "feel diffident" thinking she'll not be able to make people laugh.

247.title: Farmer dies after he sets self on fire over police inaction in UP
247.article_body: A 45-year-old farmer succumbed to his injuries on Thursday after he set himself on fire outside Uttar Pradesh's Budaun SP's office over alleged police inaction. The deceased was apparently upset over the police not filing an FIR against his relatives, whom he suspected of having set his crop on fire. Following this, an FIR was filed against eight people.

248.title: Australia reports 1st case of monkeypox in traveller from UK
248.article_body: Australia on Friday reported its first monkeypox case in a man in his 30s who recently returned from the UK. A probable case was also identified in Sydney in a man in his 40s who had recently travelled to Europe, authorities said. Cases of monkeypox have been identified in several non-endemic countries, including the US, Italy, Portugal, Spain and Canada.

249.title: I was jealous of Shabana as she used to get all the nice parts: Neena
249.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said in an interview that initially, she was "jealous of Shabana Azmi" because "she used to get all the nice parts". "There were many other actresses also. Sometimes I was told that we're doing this role but was thrown out from it," Neena said, adding that she's "much calmer" now because she's getting good parts to play.

250.title: He is a treasure: Ravi Shastri on Kuldeep Yadav's 2/14 against PBKS
250.article_body: Reacting to DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav's figures of 2/14 against PBKS, former India head coach Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Kuldeep is a treasure to be looked after." "Well done captain [Rishabh Pant] for giving him the confidence," added Shastri in his tweet. Kuldeep accounted for the dismissals of Liam Livingstone and Harpreet Brar. DC defeated PBKS by 17 runs.

251.title: Opp'n will think if 400's enough with Shaw, Pant in Indian Test side: Sehwag
251.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag said opposition will think whether scoring 400 would be enough, if opener Prithvi Shaw and wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant feature together in India's Test side. "Shaw and Pant in one team could help India rule Test cricket [and] win [the] World Test Championship," added Sehwag. "Shaw...can bring back the excitement in Test cricket," stated Sehwag.

252.title: SC directs Pegasus probe committee to submit report by June 20
252.article_body: Supreme Court has granted an extension to the committee probing the Pegasus spyware case and has directed it to submit the report by June 20. The court will hear the matter next in July. The committee told SC that it examined 29 mobile devices suspected of infection by Pegasus. It also issued notices to government agencies and other relevant persons.

253.title: Stonehenge inhabitants ate internal organs of cattle: Study
253.article_body: The analysis of 4,500-year-old faeces of humans who inhabited Stonehenge showed that they ate offal. Researchers have found evidence of eggs of parasitic worms in the faeces, which they believe shows these people ate the internal organs of cattle. They lived at a Neolithic settlement situated 2.8 km from Stonehenge and are also thought to have built the monument.

254.title: We are still the no. 1 side: Hardik Pandya on GT's 8-wicket loss vs RCB
254.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said his team is still the number one side in IPL 2022 despite their defeat against RCB by eight wickets. "[We] have defended the most number of totals while bowling second. We must have done reasonably well with the bat," added Hardik. Hardik scored 62* off 47 balls against RCB at a strike rate of 131.91.

255.title: Kishan exposed facing high-quality fast bowling vs SRH, it's a worry: Hayden
255.article_body: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden said MI opener Ishan Kishan was "exposed" while facing high-quality fast bowling against SRH, adding it is a worry. "[At] the highest level, you...[will face] a lot more of that type of bowling," stated Hayden. Discussing Kishan's dismissal, Hayden said the batter was under pressure following a bouncer on the previous delivery by Umran Malik.

256.title: BJP sees reflection of Indian culture in every regional language: PM Modi
256.article_body: Speaking on the controversies around making Hindi as the national language, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "BJP sees a reflection of Indian culture in every regional language and considers them worth worshipping." "In past few days, we have seen that attempts are being made to spark controversies...We have given importance to every regional language in NEP," the PM added.

257.title: Attempt to muzzle a strong voice: RJD as CBI raids places linked to Lalu
257.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Alok Mehta criticised the raids conducted by CBI at multiple locations linked to former Bihar Chief Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav. "This is an attempt to muzzle a strong voice. CBI's...actions are completely biased," Mehta said. Opposing the raids, Lalu's brother Prabhunath Yadav said, "It's unfortunate that a person who is ill is being deliberately troubled."

258.title: Zilingo fires CEO Ankiti Bose after suspension over financial irregularities
258.article_body: Singapore-based fashion startup Zilingo has fired CEO Ankiti Bose after previously suspending her over alleged financial irregularities. In a statement, the company said that Bose was ousted "with cause" after an investigation led by an independent forensics firm. Meanwhile, Bose in a separate statement said her employment was terminated on grounds of "insubordination".

259.title: We are going to die, that will happen 100%: SL man as PM warns of food shortages
259.article_body: After Sri Lanka's PM Ranil Wickremesinghe warned of food shortages amid the economic crisis, a man working as a part-time chauffeur said, "Without food we are going to die. That will happen hundred percent." "There is no point in talking about how hard life is. I can't predict how things will be in two months," a woman selling fruits said.

260.title: 20-yr-old man gets life sentence for killing employer in Hyderabad
260.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a 20-year-old man to life imprisonment for killing his employer. The accused, identified as Vikram, reportedly bore a grudge against his employer for not paying him a good salary. In October 2020, Vikram barged into his employer's home and attacked him with an iron rod. Vikram had also attacked the victim's wife and daughter.

261.title: Authorities demolish 48 houses in MP town after clash during wedding procession
261.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh administration demolished 48 houses on Thursday, two days after stones were hurled at a Dalit man's wedding procession. The attack took place allegedly after members of the Muslim community objected to DJ music being played in front of the mosque. Notices were issued to people after their homes were identified as an encroachment on government land.

262.title: 86% of Dia Free Juice users reduced high blood sugar in 2 months: Kapiva
262.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims 86% of Dia Free Juice users observed a drop in high blood sugar while 74% reduced their dependency on daily diabetes medication. The juice is a potent combination of Karela, Giloy, Belpatra, and Vijayasar, which improves insulin utilization, controls sugar level fluctuation, regulates metabolism, boosts energy levels, and supports weight management, Kapiva added.

263.title: Kanika Kapoor to marry NRI businessman, shares pics from mehendi ceremony
263.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor took to Instagram to share pictures from her mehendi ceremony. Kanika is getting married to NRI businessman Gautam. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "G I Love you sooooo much!" This is her second marriage after she reportedly divorced businessman Raj Chandok in 2012, with whom she has three children.

264.title: Rahul asks Cong workers to help those affected by Assam floods
264.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has urged all his party workers and leaders in Assam to provide assistance in relief operations in the recent floods and landslides that have taken place in the state. "Lakhs of people are affected by severe flooding," Gandhi tweeted. Notably, over 7 lakh people have been affected by the calamity, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

265.title: Shanghai detects new infections after 5 days of zero COVID-19 cases
265.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Thursday reported new COVID-19 cases outside quarantined areas for the first time after five days of no infections. All three people who tested positive in Xujing Town in Qingpu district were triple-vaccinated and were from the same family, authorities said. The town's over 2,00,000 people have been re-tested and all results were negative, they added.

266.title: Wild accusations untrue, it never happened: Musk on sexual harassment claims
266.article_body: Reacting to the sexual harassment allegations against him, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted that the "wild accusations are utterly untrue." He added, "I've a challenge to this liar who claims their friend saw me "exposed"...describe just one thing, anything at all (scars, tattoos) that isn't known by the public. She won't be able to do so, because it never happened."

267.title: Our challan will meet him soon: Mumbai Police on picture of man taking selfie on road
267.article_body: Reacting to a complaint shared by a Twitter page called 'mumbaimatterz' in which a man can be seen taking selfie on his scooty in the middle of a road, Mumbai Police said, "Our challan will meet him soon." Retweeting the picture of the man, the police wrote, "Ab inhone bulaya hai toh jaana hi hoga...mauka bhi hai...kanoon bhi!"

268.title: SpiceJet flights stopped over non-payment of dues at Delhi airport
268.article_body: The Delhi ATC had stopped several SpiceJet flights on Friday as the airline did not make the requisite daily payment to the AAI. The ATC was instructed not to give clearance to the flights to take off as the payment was not made. SpiceJet said the payment failed due to a glitch in the software through which it makes payment.

269.title: What is Twitter's new 'crisis misinformation' policy?
269.article_body: Designed to tackle "situations of armed conflict, public health emergencies, and large-scale natural disasters," the policy ​will help hide tweets that share false information during such situations. While Twitter said it would rely on various credible sources to check if a tweet is misleading, it will also prioritise adding warning notices to viral tweets and tweets from high-profile accounts.

270.title: B'luru Customs intercept parcel with ₹20 lakh-cannabis; 1 arrested
270.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Thursday that its officers intercepted a parcel that originated from the US at the Foreign Post Office and detected cannabis worth approximately ₹20 lakh. It said that one person, who was caught during the controlled delivery operation, has been arrested and remanded to judicial custody. The seized cannabis weighs 950 gm, it added.

271.title: Sri Lanka closes schools, limits work amid fuel shortage
271.article_body: Sri Lanka on Friday closed schools and asked non-essential public officials not to come to work amid fuel shortage. Authorities have also announced nationwide power cuts of up to four hours a day because they cannot supply enough fuel to power generating stations. Sri Lanka is now almost without gasoline and faces an acute shortage of other fuels.

272.title: Hardik Patel quit Congress fearing jail in sedition cases: Jagdish Thakor
272.article_body: After Hardik Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday, the party's Gujarat chief Jagdish Thakor claimed, "Hardik feared that he may have to go to jail in sedition cases if he stays in the Congress." "Hence, to save himself from the possible punishment, he decided to quit the Congress and he might join the BJP as well," he added.

273.title: Pune Police transfers Ruby Hall Clinic case to crime branch
273.article_body: The Pune Police have transferred the alleged kidney transplant malpractice case at the city's Ruby Hall Clinic to the crime branch unit on Thursday. "They (crime branch) have taken the case papers today (Thursday)," said Additional Commissioner of Police (Crime) Ramnath Pokale. Notably, the FIR names 15 persons, with the police having arrested two middlemen so far.

274.title: Air India plane makes emergency landing in Mumbai after engine shuts down midair
274.article_body: An Air India flight, headed to Bengaluru, made an emergency landing in Mumbai soon after take-off on Thursday morning after one of its engines shut down midair. "The aircraft came back due to a technical glitch. Our...teams have started looking into it. Meanwhile, another aircraft was arranged for passengers to fly to Bengaluru," Air India spokesperson said.

275.title: Man stabs woman to death at Goa beach for ending relationship, held
275.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stabbing a 19-year-old woman to death at Goa's Velsao beach after she refused to continue relationship with him, police said. The accused was arrested a day after the woman's body was found in the bushes by the beach. "The accused was in love with woman, who was studying in a college," police added.

276.title: While other kids went to play, Rimmi & I worked: Celina recalls modelling days
276.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly took to Instagram to share throwback pictures from her modelling days with her school friend, actress Rimmi Sen. Celina, who started modelling at the age of 16, wrote, "While other kids went to play after school and on weekends, Rimmi and I went to work." "I think sometimes we even studied on our shoots," she further wrote.

277.title: Twitter to label false tweets on Ukraine, disable likes, retweets
277.article_body: Twitter has announced that it will start putting misleading and false posts regarding the conflict in Ukraine behind a warning notice and limit their spread. The platform will not amplify or recommend such tweets and likes, retweets and shares will be disabled. It'll prioritise adding labels to misleading tweets from high-profile accounts such as verified users or official government profiles.

278.title: Pune Customs intercept vehicle near temple, seize 51 kg marijuana
278.article_body: Pune Customs said on Thursday that its Narcotics Cell intercepted a vehicle near the Khandoba Temple in Jejuri and seized 51 kg of marijuana from it. Two people have been arrested in the matter. On searching the vehicle, three gunny bags were found concealed below the passenger seat and the marijuana was recovered, Pune Customs Deputy Commissioner Himani Dhamija said.

279.title: SP leader Azam Khan released from Sitapur jail after 27 months
279.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan was released from UP's Sitapur district jail on Friday, a day after Supreme Court granted him interim bail in an alleged case of cheating. SC also gave Khan two weeks to apply for regular bail before the concerned court. Khan had been in jail for the last 27 months in connection with several cases.

280.title: Sidhu seeks few weeks' time from SC to surrender in 1988 road rage case
280.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu has sought a few weeks' time from Supreme Court to surrender in the 1988 road rage case citing some "medical conditions". SC asked Sidhu's lawyer to move a proper application and mention it before the CJI bench. This comes a day after Sidhu was sentenced to one year in jail in connection with the case.

281.title: Vijay meets T'gana CM K Chandrashekar Rao amid Thalapathy 66 shoot in Hyd
281.article_body: Actor Vijay, who is currently shooting for his upcoming project with filmmaker Vamshi Paidipally, met Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday. Vijay met the CM along with Vamshi at Pragathi Bhavan in Hyderabad. The project, tentatively titled 'Thalapathy 66', also stars Rashmika Mandanna and Sarath Kumar, among others.

282.title: He is drunk in appeasement politics: Maurya on Akhilesh's remark on temples
282.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said that he is drunk in "appeasement politics". "Akhilesh Yadav ji has forgotten the essence of 'sanatan' Hinduism," Maurya added. Earlier, Akhilesh said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."

283.title: Akasa Air's launch may be postponed over delay in aircraft delivery
283.article_body: The launch of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air is likely to be delayed further as the airline expects to receive its first aircraft in June or July, as per a DGCA official. Akasa Air had initially planned to start its operations in June. Akasa Air has said it intends to start commercial operations in July.

284.title: Google deceptively collects data in Incognito mode: US lawsuit
284.article_body: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed an amended privacy lawsuit against Google accusing it of collecting data of users who think they can be anonymous if they use the Incognito mode. "In reality, Google deceptively collects an array of personal data even when a user has engaged Incognito mode," the suit alleges. "We...will vigorously defend ourselves," Google has said.

285.title: Told Rahul to expel Sidhu, Jakhar but he didn't listen: Sukhjinder Randhawa
285.article_body: Congress leader and former Deputy CM of Punjab Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa on Thursday claimed that he had told the Congress leadership, including Rahul Gandhi, in February to expel both Navjot Singh Sidhu and Sunil Jakhar from the party. However, Rahul Gandhi did not listen to him, Randhawa said. "What Congress couldn't do, Supreme Court has done today," Randhawa added.

286.title: 1955 Mercedes-Benz car sold for record-breaking ₹1,100 crore in Germany
286.article_body: A 1955 Mercedes-Benz 300 SLR Uhlenhaut Coupé sold for €135 million (over ₹1,100 crore) in a secret auction in Germany on May 5, Mercedes-Benz Chairman Ola Källenius has confirmed. The sale broke the previous public record of $48.4 million paid in 2018 for a 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO at an RM Sotheby’s auction.

287.title: You can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time: Hardik Patel to Congress
287.article_body: Patidar leader Hardik Patel on Thursday criticised the Congress for purportedly "taking out anger" over PM Narendra Modi being from Gujarat on businessmen like Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. "A businessman rises due to his or her own hard work. [Congress] can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time," he added. This comes after Patel resigned from the Congress on Wednesday.

288.title: Pune-Delhi SpiceJet flight delayed by 7 hrs due to operational reasons
288.article_body: A Pune-Delhi SpiceJet flight got delayed by 7 hours in its take-off from the Pune airport in Lohegaon on Wednesday due to "operational reasons". The flight was supposed to take-off at 5.35 pm but got as late as 12:30 am. "SpiceJet flight SG 8184 was delayed...Passengers were informed about the revised departure time at 2 pm," a SpiceJet spokesperson said.

289.title: Russia using food as a weapon in Ukraine: US
289.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia is "using food as a weapon" in Ukraine. "The food supply for millions of Ukrainians and millions more around the world has quite literally been held hostage by the Russian military," he added. Reacting to Blinken's allegations, a senior Russian official said Russians "weren't idiots" and wouldn't export food amid tough sanctions.

290.title: BJP has encroached on government land in Delhi: AAP
290.article_body: AAP on Thursday released a list of BJP leaders accusing them of encroaching on government land in Delhi and asked when the party would run bulldozers over their illegal construction. "We've photographic evidence of residences of BJP leaders...which clearly shows encroachment, illegal occupation of government land and unauthorised constructions," said Saurabh Bharadwaj, Chief Spokesperson, AAP.

291.title: Domestic help beaten up by couple, found in pool of urine in Delhi
291.article_body: A 48-year-old woman, who worked as domestic help, was allegedly beaten up by her employers in Delhi's Rajouri Garden, police said. "The couple dropped her at my office...Later, I found her lying in her own urine and saw that she couldn't move," her placement agency's owner said. The victim's employers also allegedly chopped off her hair, police added.

292.title: Attacks on me should be seen via political lens: Musk after sexual misconduct claims
292.article_body: Tesla CEO on Friday tweeted, "Attacks against me should be viewed through a political lens...this is their standard (despicable) playbook...But nothing will deter me from fighting for a good future and your right to free speech." Musk's tweet comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant, who worked for SpaceX's corporate jet in 2016.

293.title: TN Cong protest over Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
293.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee on Thursday held silent protests in parts of the state over the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in late PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. Party workers covered their mouths with a white cloth during the protests. Congress should "withdraw its support to DMK government" over the issue, state BJP chief K Annamalai said.

294.title: 2 policemen electrocuted on paddy field in Kerala
294.article_body: Two policemen died of electrocution on a paddy field near their camp in Kerala's Palakkad on Thursday. According to police, the victims, Ashokan and Mohandas, came in contact with a live wire trap laid to catch wild boars that enter the field to eat up the crops. Two locals have been arrested for their alleged involvement in laying the trap.

295.title: Health is the real wealth, don’t miss out on health investment: Diataal
295.article_body: Diataal has been relaunched in the market with Bollywood's mother-son duo Neetu Kapoor & Ranbir Kapoor. They've come together to endorse a brand for the first time. The brand said, Diataal takes care of 16 vital vitamins & minerals to ensure overall well-being and taking 1 Diataal daily after meals is your first step towards good health and well-being.

296.title: Pak bans imports of all non-essential luxury items to stabilise economy
296.article_body: Pakistan has banned the import of all non-essential luxury items in order to stabilise its economy, said the information minister on Thursday. The items included in the ban are cars, mobile phones, home appliances and cosmetics. Amid declining foreign exchange reserves, the minister said, "There is an emergency situation in the country."

297.title: Kangana Ranaut buys Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore
297.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has bought a Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore. She unveiled her new car in front of the paparazzi on Thursday, ahead of the screening of her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad' in Mumbai. Kangana attended the premiere of 'Dhaakad' with her parents, sister Rangoli Chandel, brother Aksht Ranaut and sister-in-law Ritu Sangwan.

298.title: Samsung leader excused from trial hearing ahead of Biden's plant visit
298.article_body: Samsung leader Jay Y Lee has been excused from attending an accounting fraud trial hearing on Friday, ahead of US President Joe Biden's tour of a Samsung plant in South Korea. Lee is expected to accompany Biden during his tour of the plant in Pyeongtaek. The plant is expected to be Biden's first stop on his trip to South Korea.

299.title: Drive against illegal parking launched by traffic police in Noida
299.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Traffic Police launched a drive against illegal parking in the district. The officials removed illegally parked vehicles from several areas including Model Town crossing, Surajpur and Pari Chowk. "In some areas...vehicles are parked along roads, leading to traffic jams...We request residents to visit our Twitter page to complain about congested stretches," an official said.

300.title: Virat Kohli consoles angry Matthew Wade after controversial dismissal, pics go viral
300.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli was seen consoling GT's Matthew Wade, who was angry at being adjudged LBW out despite his bat seemingly hitting the ball. As Wade was walking back to the pavilion, Kohli went towards Wade and put his arm around Wade's shoulder. Wade was later seen throwing his bat and helmet in anger in the dressing room.

301.title: He is a 'pocket rocket': Ravi Shastri on Rinku Singh's 40 (15) vs LSG
301.article_body: Discussing KKR batter Rinku Singh's 40 off 15 balls against LSG, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Rinku is a "pocket rocket" adding that his knock brought KKR back in the game out of nowhere. "Rinku may be small in frame but hits the ball really hard. [I] really enjoyed his batting," stated Shastri. LSG defeated KKR by two runs.

302.title: 'It's hell there': Ukraine Prez says Russia has fully destroyed Donbas
302.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russian forces have "completely destroyed" the Donbas region and accused Moscow of carrying out "senseless" bombardments as it intensified its offensive. "It's hell there and that's not an exaggeration," he added. Zelenskyy also accused Russian forces of attempting to "kill as many Ukrainians as possible", repeating that Russia is committing "genocide".

303.title: Jakhar started working for BJP long before joining it: Punjab Cong chief
303.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja criticised Sunil Jakhar for leaving Congress and joining BJP and said that Jakhar's move was "not unexpected" as he had been working for the party long before joining it. Jakhar was doing "Hindutva politics"  and the reason for doing so is revealed now, Raja added. Jakhar was damaging Congress in every way, Raja said.

304.title: India reports 2,259 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,044
304.article_body: India has reported 2,259 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,364 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 15,044, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,323, according to the latest data.

305.title: Congress alleges over ₹9,000 cr scam in proposals cleared by BMC
305.article_body: Congress on Thursday alleged a TDR (Transferable Development Rights) scam of ₹9,380 crore in proposals cleared by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). Former opposition leader Ravi Raja made the allegations in context of the construction of 14,000 tenements for Project Affected Persons in Chandivali, Mulund, Bhandup and Parel. "There're large scale irregularities in the project," Raja said.

306.title: Bengaluru airport receives hoax bomb threat call, security heightened
306.article_body: The authorities at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport received a hoax call claiming the presence of a bomb at the airport on Friday. Security was heightened at the airport following the threat call. "Today early morning, a bomb threat call was received by the control room. It is being verified by the police. Further details will be shared later," police said.

307.title: Something weird is going on in our universe: NASA
307.article_body: Hubble Space Telescope has reached a new milestone in its work to find out how quickly the universe is expanding, NASA said, adding that data suggests "something weird is going on". "There is a discrepancy between the expansion rate as measured in the local universe compared to independent observations from right after the big bang," NASA said.

308.title: She was encouraged to get licensed as masseuse for Musk: Flight attendant's friend
308.article_body: After a flight attendant alleged sexual harassment by Tesla CEO Elon Musk in 2016, her friend said seniors at her workplace encouraged her friend to "get licensed as a masseuse" for sessions with Musk. She said, "They implied that she'd get to fly more often if she were to do this because she'd be able to give Elon proper massages."

309.title: Haven't worked on Dogecoin for 7.5 yrs, & won't ever again: Co-creator
309.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to clarify that he doesn't work on Dogecoin anymore, saying, "I haven't for 7.5 years, and I won't ever again." "One goal here is just to help people see the cryptocurrency market for what it actually is. Doing so in an amusing way is a bonus," he added.

310.title: Food stall owner arrested for social media post on Sharad Pawar in Panvel
310.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly posting objectionable comments on social media against Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar. Earlier this month, Marathi actor Ketaki Chitale posted an alleged defamatory post about Pawar on Facebook. As per police, Kiran Inamdar, who runs a food stall in Panvel, shared a similar post.

311.title: My blazer made by PM Modi's tailors, we've great friendship: Caribbean nation's PM
311.article_body: During President Ram Nath Kovind's visit to the Caribbean nation, St Vincent and the Grenadines PM Ralph Everard Gonsalves said, "PM Narendra Modi's tailors made the suit that I'm wearing today to welcome my friend President Kovind." "PM Modi and I have a great friendship. We're both humorous and have a concern for humanity, peace and security," he added.

312.title: Extreme monsoon may bring knee-deep flooding in Mumbai: Maha Min
312.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said that despite elaborate arrangements underway for monsoon, Mumbai could be submerged under knee-deep flooding if there is extreme rainfall in the city. If there is over 200 mm rain in a day, any city, not just Mumbai will see flooding, he added. "The fury of nature can be stopped by no one," he stated.

313.title: Part of tunnel on Jammu-Srinagar highway collapses in Ramban, 10 labourers trapped
313.article_body: A part of an under-construction tunnel collapsed at Khooni Nala on the Jammu-Srinagar highway in the Magarkote area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban. "Nearly 10 labourers trapped under the debris. Another 2 rescued and hospitalised with injuries. Rescue operations going on in full swing. Civil administration and Police authorities are monitoring the situation," Union minister Jitendra Singh said.

314.title: 4 school kids, 5 women drown in separate incidents in 2 Pune dams
314.article_body: Nine people, including four schoolchildren and five women, drowned in two separate incidents at the Bhatghar and Chaskaman dams respectively in Pune on Thursday. The students may have drowned after "failing to gauge the depth while in the waters", Pune Rural SP Abhinav Deshmukh said. The deceased women had come for a wedding to a nearby village, he added.

315.title: Boeing launches Starliner capsule to orbit on uncrewed test flight
315.article_body: Boeing launched its Starliner spacecraft on an uncrewed test flight to orbit on Thursday. The test will show if the spacecraft is capable of carrying humans to the International Space Station. Boeing had attempted to conduct the mission in August last year but was forced to abandon it after some propellant valves were found to not be working properly.

316.title: Policeman caught accepting ₹20,000 bribe in Maharashtra's Thane
316.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) of Thane unit arrested an assistant police inspector (API) for accepting a bribe of ₹20,000. According to officials, the accused had allegedly demanded ₹25,000 from the complainant for not registering an offence against the company he worked for. The Thane ACB then laid a trap and caught API Dhananjay Ghange while accepting the bribe.

317.title: Not interested in attending US-hosted summit: Nicaragua Prez
317.article_body: Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega has said that his government is "not interested" in attending the next month's US-hosted Summit of the Americas. Some leaders have criticised the summit after reports suggested the US may exclude Nicaragua, Cuba, and Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's government from it. "This summit doesn't dignify anyone, rather, it dirties them...sullies them," Ortega said.

318.title: Politically motivated: Musk on report claiming he sexually harassed a flight attendant
318.article_body: Responding to a report claiming he sexually harassed a flight attendant in 2016, Tesla CEO Elon Musk called the story a "politically motivated hit piece". When asked for a comment on the accusations, he said, "If I were inclined to engage in sexual harassment, this is unlikely to be the first time in my...30-year career that it comes to light."

319.title: B'luru saw one of the heaviest rains in May in 40-50 yrs: Bommai
319.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai visited parts of Bengaluru after rainfall caused flooding and said that it's "one of the heaviest rains that the city has witnessed in...May in last 40-50 years". He added that ₹1,600 crore has already been set aside to modernise stormwater drains. Earlier, ₹25,000 compensation was announced for people whose houses were damaged amid rains in Bengaluru.

320.title: Mumbai records over 5,000 property registrations since start of 2022
320.article_body: Over 5,000 property registrations have been done in Mumbai since the beginning of this year till May 19 which has led to a revenue generation of ₹448.40 crore from stamp duty fees, according to IGR Maharashtra's data. In 2018, total property registration recorded was 6,672, in 2019 it was 6,270, in 2020 it was 207, and in 2021 was 5,360.

321.title: Aurangzeb Lane signboard defaced by BJP Yuva Morcha in Delhi
321.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha members on Thursday defaced the Aurangzeb Lane signboard in Lutyens' Delhi and pasted a banner that read 'Baba Vishwanath Marg' over it. BJYM president Vasu Rukhar said that if the lane is not renamed, the workers will take to the streets. "A case under the Delhi Prevention of Defacement of Property Act is being registered," police said.

322.title: India responds after satellite image shows China building bridge on Pangong Tso lake
322.article_body: India is closely monitoring the construction of a bridge by China on the Pangong Tso lake, the Ministry of External Affairs said. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said that the area where the reported construction is being undertaken has been considered an "occupied area" by India for decades. "This is a military issue so I can't discuss implications," he added.

323.title: Rihanna and A$AP Rocky blessed with a baby boy: Reports
323.article_body: Singer Rihanna and rapper A$AP Rocky have been blessed with a baby boy, multiple reports said. Rihanna gave birth on May 13 in Los Angeles, TMZ reported, citing sources. Rihanna and A$AP Rocky have been dating since early 2020. They went public with their relationship in November of that same year.

324.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as RCB enter top 4?
324.article_body: RCB have moved to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table with their victory against table-toppers GT. RR and RCB have 16 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR). DC are fifth on the points table with 14 points. KKR, PBKS, SRH, CSK and MI have been eliminated from playoffs race.

325.title: Ed Sheeran secretly welcomes 2nd baby girl with wife Cherry Seaborn
325.article_body: Singer Ed Sheeran has welcomed his second baby girl after having kept his wife Cherry Seaborn's pregnancy a secret. "Want to let you all know we've had another beautiful baby girl. We're both so in love with her and over the moon to be a family of four," he wrote on Instagram. The couple's first daughter was born in 2020.

326.title: Indore's drone startup sprays fertiliser over 4,000 acres of land
326.article_body: Drone startup SkyLane Dronetech has sprayed fertiliser over 4,000 acres of agricultural land using a drone. "We have sprayed fertilisers in...Khargone, Raisen, Shajapur, Rajgarh, Guna and Gwalior districts with...a drone to do a business of ₹12.5 lakh,'' SkyLane CEO Prayas Saxena said. The Indore-based startup received ₹2 crore loan from the central government's Agriculture Infrastructure Fund.

327.title: Musk shares meme, says 'Tesla on my mind 24/7' amid concerns about Twitter distraction
327.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted a meme and wrote, "Tesla is on my mind 24/7" amid concerns that he was getting distracted by the Twitter acquisition deal. Sharing the meme, he wrote, "So may seem like below, but not true. To be clear, I'm spending less than 5% (but actually) of my time on the Twitter acquisition."

328.title: CBI raids 15 locations linked to Lalu, daughter in fresh corruption case
328.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a fresh corruption case against Rashtriya Janata Dal president Lalu Prasad Yadav over alleged irregularities in recruitment during his tenure as Bihar Chief Minister. CBI on Friday started searches at 15 locations linked to Yadav and his daughter. This comes a month after Yadav was granted bail in the fifth fodder scam case.

329.title: SpaceX paid $250,000 to cover up Musk's sexual misconduct in 2018: Report
329.article_body: SpaceX paid a flight attendant $250,000 to settle a sexual misconduct claim against CEO Elon Musk in 2018, as per a report. The flight attendant, who worked for Space X's corporate jet, accused Musk of exposing himself, rubbing her leg without her consent and offering to buy her a horse in exchange for an erotic massage in 2016.

330.title: Musk's deal moving forward as planned, not on 'hold': Twitter executives tell staff
330.article_body: Twitter executives told their staff that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's acquisition offer is moving forward as planned and that there is "no such thing as a deal being on hold," as per the employees. While Musk had earlier suggested he might seek a lower price for the deal, executives said they won't renegotiate the agreed-upon price of $54.20 per share.

331.title: Madame Tussauds wax museum to open in Noida next month
331.article_body: The Madame Tussauds wax museum, which had shut shop at Connaught Place's Regal Building in 2020, is set to reopen in Noida's DLF Mall of India next month. "The project is under construction," said a spokesperson from the museum's holding company. The new location has been chosen as it caters to population from Delhi/NCR and Uttar Pradesh, the company added.

332.title: Virat Kohli smashes 73(54) as RCB beat GT to stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race
332.article_body: Virat Kohli smashed 73(54) as RCB chased down 169-run target in 18.4 overs to defeat GT in their last league stage match of IPL 2022. RCB moved to the fourth position on the points table with 16 points and are still in contention for a playoffs spot. Meanwhile, PBKS and SRH have been eliminated from the playoffs race.

333.title: Which countries have detected monkeypox cases so far?
333.article_body: Spain reported seven cases of monkeypox and Portugal updated its number of confirmed cases to 14. Italy on Thursday reported its first monkeypox case. One person in Sweden has a confirmed case of monkeypox. In UK, nine cases have been reported and health officials in Canada are investigating up to 13 cases. US also reported a case of monkeypox.

334.title: Odisha groom cycles to wedding venue to protest against fuel prices
334.article_body: A groom rode a cycle to the wedding venue in Odisha's Bhubaneswar as a protest against rising fuel prices in the country. His family and friends followed him on foot to attend the wedding. The groom, Subhranshu Samal, said his family had arranged for an expensive marriage procession. "As an individual, I preferred to show my displeasure," Subhranshu said.

335.title: AIIMS Delhi removes all user charges for tests costing up to ₹300
335.article_body: The AIIMS Delhi on Thursday removed user charges for all tests and diagnostics currently costing up to ₹300 with immediate effect. The charges in private and deluxe wards have been increased and the ordinary private rooms will now cost ₹3,000 per day as compared to the previous charge of ₹2,000, another notification read. It'll be applicable from June 1.

336.title: Big B, SRK, Ajay Devgn & Ranveer Singh accused of 'promoting tobacco' in petition
336.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan, Shah Rukh Khan, Ajay Devgn and Ranveer Singh have been accused of "promoting consumption of gutkha and tobacco" in a petition filed before a Bihar court. The plea has been filed before the court of Chief Judicial Magistrate, Muzaffarpur, by city-based social activist Tamanna Hashmi. It sought directions to the police that FIR be lodged against the actors.

337.title: Hardik Pandya's bat goes flying in the air, lands near square-leg region; IPL share video
337.article_body: On the last delivery of GT's 10th over against RCB, GT captain Hardik Pandya lost the grip of his bat, which then flew and landed near the square-leg region. "I reckon it's a bit sticky and moist out there," commentator Matthew Hayden said. "The bat travelled further than the ball," joked Harsha Bhogle.

338.title: Union IT Minister successfully tests 5G call at IIT Madras; shares video
338.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday successfully tested 5G audio and video call at IIT Madras. "Aatmanirbhar 5G...The entire end-to-end network is designed and developed in India," the minister tweeted as he shared a video of the 5G call. The IIT Madras-led 5G testbed, built at a cost of ₹220 crore, was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday.

339.title: Uber to show drop location in advance to drivers to minimize cancellations
339.article_body: Uber India addressed the issue of drivers cancelling rides over drop locations and said, "We're now showing trip destinations to drivers before they decide to accept the ride." It added, "Drivers who meet a predefined trip acceptance threshold will be eligible to get destination information." The feature is already live across 20 cities and will be expanded to all cities.

340.title: Not everything is promotional: Kartik on link-up rumours with Sara
340.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan was asked if reports of his link-up rumours with actress Sara Ali Khan being a promotional stint for their film 'Love Aaj Kal 2' are true. To this, he replied, "No...There was nothing promotional there." "We are humans as well. Not everything is promotional. This is all that I will say on this topic," he added.

341.title: No Maoists in Jhargram: Mamata as she warns against 'fake news'
341.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said there were no Maoists in Jhargram and warned of strict action against those spreading "fake news". "Around 1,000 people who were active Maoists, surrendered and have been employed as home guards or in the police force," Mamata said. She also criticised the BJP government and alleged they were harassing TMC through central agencies.

342.title: Payal Rohatgi & Sangram Singh announce their wedding, to be held in July
342.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi and her long-time boyfriend Sangram Singh have announced their wedding. Taking to Instagram, Sangram wrote, "Coming this July...Where we get to say the vows!!! And be wedding-bound!" Sangram told The Indian Express the marriage was initially planned to take place on July 21, however, he said they'll confirm the date after consulting with their pandits.

343.title: India achieving new heights under PM Modi: Yogi Adityanath
343.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that India has been moving towards new heights in the last eight years, adding that the country only crawled for 70 years. Speaking at Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav program, he said, "This is the first time after independence that the country is taking forward (development) programs under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi."

344.title: Will hold talks with Naxals if they have faith in Constitution: Baghel
344.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that he will hold peace talks with Naxals only if they have faith in the Indian Constitution. "My doors are open for dialogues. I'm ready to come anywhere to talk only if they have faith in the Indian Constitution," Baghel said. Earlier this month, Maoists released a statement stating they were ready for talks.

345.title: Chinese President urges BRICS countries to strengthen cooperation
345.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday said that BRICS countries need to strengthen security cooperation and they need to maintain close communication and coordination on major international issues. He added that the five BRICS countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) should "oppose hegemonism and power politics and work together to build a global community of security for all".

346.title: Go First planning to raise ₹3,600 cr through an IPO in July: Report
346.article_body: Go First is planning to raise ₹3,600 crore through an IPO in July this year as air travel recovers, Bloomberg reported. According to Go First's draft preliminary prospectus, the firm, previously known as GoAir, had obligations of about ₹8,160 crore as of April 2021. Go First will begin adding 10 new Airbus SE A320neo aircraft starting August.

347.title: AIIMS removes all laboratory & testing charges up to ₹300
347.article_body: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) on Thursday announced abolition of laboratory and testing charges up to ₹300 with immediate effect. The charges in private and deluxe wards have been increased and the ordinary private rooms will now cost ₹3,000 per day as compared to the previous charge of ₹2,000. It'll be applicable with effect from June 1.

348.title: WHO approves China's CanSino COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use
348.article_body: WHO has issued an emergency use listing for CONVIDECIA, a COVID-19 vaccine manufactured by China's CanSino Biologics. WHO has recommended the vaccine's use for people aged 18 and above. The vaccine has reportedly shown efficacy of 64% against symptomatic disease and 92% against severe COVID-19 infection, it said. Notably, this is the third Chinese vaccine to be granted such clearance.

349.title: Cong workers hold cylinders, protest against inflation in Kolkata
