349.article_body: Congress protested against inflation in Kolkata, where protesters held cylinders and raised slogans against the Central and state government. "The Union government has increased excise duty on petroleum products and the state govt has imposed VAT on these products," West Bengal Congress Chief Adhir Chowdhury said. This comes after LPG prices were increased for the second time this month.

350.title: Ukraine to seek compensation from Russia over environmental damage
350.article_body: Ukraine will seek compensation from Russia in international courts over environmental damage amid former's invasion, Ukraine's Environment Minister Ruslan Strilets said on Thursday. "Russian missiles hit our oil depots [and] chemical plants...Forests are burning, valuable protected things are being destroyed," he added. Kyiv has recorded 1,500 cases of destruction of ecosystems, he further said.

351.title: Chhattisgarh man trying to buy a cake online cheated of ₹1.90 lakh
351.article_body: Police said that a Chhattisgarh man trying to send a birthday cake to his daughter in Thane was cheated of ₹1.90 lakh. Police said that the fraudsters asked the man to share his bank account details for advance payment and syphoned money from his account. They repeated the same with his daughter and transferred ₹9,000 from her account, police added.

352.title: Sri Lanka has secured sufficient fuel stocks to last till mid-June: PM
352.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament on Thursday that the country has secured sufficient fuel stocks to last till mid-June. He added that while replenished stocks are expected to ease fuel demand, the queues at fuel stations "will not completely disperse". This comes a day after government urged citizens to stop queuing at fuel pumps amid forex shortage crisis.

353.title: Johnny Depp admitted to cutting the tip of his finger himself, witness tells court
353.article_body: Raquel Pennington, a witness for Amber Heard, told the court how Johnny Depp told her he had injured the tip of his finger himself during a March 2015 incident in Australia. Depp previously testified his former wife had "thrown a vodka bottle at me and took my finger off". Pennington claimed there "were many times" she saw injuries on Heard.

354.title: Uber India hikes cab fares in several cities, cites rising fuel prices
354.article_body: Uber India on Thursday said, "Over the past few weeks, we've raised fares to cushion drivers from the impact of rising fuel prices across many cities." It added, "This will directly boost the drivers' earnings per trip." The ride-hailing company said the decision was taken after drivers raised concerns about earnings and riders complained of drivers not switching on AC.

355.title: Wade angrily throws his helmet and bat in dressing room after controversial dismissal
355.article_body: A video has gone viral showing GT's Matthew Wade angrily throwing his helmet and bat in the dressing room after his controversial dismissal against RCB on Thursday. Wade was adjudged LBW by the on-field umpire after which he took a review claiming the bat had touched the ball. The UltraEdge, however, didn't pick the edge and Wade was declared out.

356.title: Noida man takes pet dog to Kedarnath, makes him touch Nandi idol; priests to file case
356.article_body: A Noida-based man recently took his pet dog to Kedarnath shrine and shared videos and pictures of his pet touching Nandi idol to seek blessings and getting tilak from a priest. Several people criticised the man's actions, with the temple committee and priests saying that they have decided to take legal action against the man.

357.title: Need to create reliable supply chains: Jaishankar at BRICS meet
357.article_body: Union Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar, while addressing the BRICS Foreign Ministers' meeting on Thursday, highlighted the need to create resilient and reliable supply chains. He said, "Knock-on effects of the Ukraine conflict have led to sharp increases in the costs of energy, food and commodities." He added this must be mitigated for the sake of the developing world.

358.title: Depp will emerge with his good name: Eva Green on defamation trial
358.article_body: Actress Eva Green took to Instagram to support actor Johnny Depp in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. "I have no doubt Johnny will emerge with his good name and wonderful heart revealed to the world," she wrote while sharing a picture with Depp. "Life will be better than it ever was for Depp and his family," she added.

359.title: US Prez to hold bilateral meeting with PM Modi during Quad Summit
359.article_body: US President Joe Biden will hold a bilateral meeting with PM Narendra Modi on the sidelines of his visit to Japan for Quad Leaders' Summit, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said. The summit is scheduled to be held on May 24 in Tokyo. Biden will also be launching an economic initiative in Tokyo called the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF).

360.title: Sri Lanka lowers amount of foreign currency people can hold amid crisis
360.article_body: Sri Lanka will reduce amount of foreign currency that individuals can possess from $15,000 to $10,000 and punish anyone holding it for over three months, country's central bank said. People must place their excess foreign currency in bank or convert it into local currency within two weeks, bank's governor said. Sri Lanka's facing shortage of forex reserves amid economic crisis.

361.title: India's Nikhat Zareen wins gold medal at Women's World Boxing Championships
361.article_body: India's 25-year-old boxer Nikhat Zareen on Thursday won the gold medal in the 52-kg category at the Women's World Boxing Championships 2022. Nikhat defeated Thailand's Jitpong Jutamas in the final. India have now won a total of 10 gold medals in the Women's World Boxing Championships history, with Mary Kom clinching six of them.

362.title: Video of 'Avengers' star Jeremy Renner dancing in Rajasthan goes viral
362.article_body: A video of 'Avengers' actor Jeremy Renner dancing with schoolchildren in Alwar, Rajasthan has gone viral on social media. This comes after a video of Jeremy applauding actor Anil Kapoor's dance in front of schoolchildren had gone viral. Anil and Jeremy, who featured together in 'Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol', were spotted shooting for a series called 'Rennervations'.

363.title: Men who are gay, bisexual should be aware of any unusual rashes: UK govt on monkeypox
363.article_body: Amid confirmation of monkeypox cases, UK Health Security Agency has warned "men who are gay and bisexual" to be aware of unusual rashes or lesions. They've been advised to contact a sexual health service without delay if they have concerns. Monkeypox hasn't previously been described as sexually transmitted infection, though it can be passed on by direct contact during sex.

364.title: Need to restructure debts to pay them back: Sri Lankan central bank Governor
364.article_body: Central Bank of Sri Lanka Governor P Nandalal Weerasinghe on Thursday said the country will not be able to pay back its debts until it restructures them. Calling for early appointment of financial advisors and lawyers for the debt restructuring process, Weerasinghe said there is an urgent need for Sri Lanka's new leaders to bring stability to the economic situation.

365.title: Thoko Tali!: Amarinder's party tweets after Sidhu gets 1-year jail
365.article_body: After Supreme Court sentenced Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a 1988 road rage case, his former party colleague Captain Amarinder Singh's Punjab Lok Congress tweeted, "Thoko Tali! (clap your hands)." It is Sidhu's famous dialogue from a television comedy show. The SC had spared Sidhu a jail term in 2018.

366.title: Russia must not win war, Ukraine must prevail: German Chancellor
366.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday described the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine as the "greatest crisis the EU is facing in its history". Addressing Germany's Parliament, Scholz said, "We...share one goal, Russia must not win this war, Ukraine must prevail." Scholz's remarks came ahead of a special meeting of the European Council over the war in Ukraine.

367.title: 2,000 more paramilitary personnel to be deployed in Punjab: CM Mann
367.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said about 2,000 more paramilitary personnel will be deployed in the state to boost security. After meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Mann said, "There have been regular inputs that some miscreants are trying to create trouble in Punjab." He added that 10 companies of paramilitary personnel have already reached Punjab.

368.title: 'Anek', 'Article 15' shouldn't be seen with commercial lens: Ayushmann
368.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his films 'Anek' and 'Article 15' shouldn't be seen with a commercial lens. "They're films that are very important for society...you can't compare these films with 'Dream Girl' or 'Bala' because they are mass entertainers," the actor added. Speaking about 'Anek', he said, "It's an intelligent film. For this film, you need both brain and heart."

369.title: Russian govt to help McDonald's Russia business owner to set up: Report
369.article_body: Russian government will assist McDonald's Russia business' new owner in setting up, news agency TASS reported quoting Russian Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov on Thursday. McDonald's said it will sell its Russia business to its current licensee Alexander Govor. Govor will operate McDonald's restaurants in Russia under a new brand and will retain employees for at least two years.

370.title: Deeply aggrieved: Zepto after delivery boy dies in alleged hit-and-run in Delhi
370.article_body: Ten-minute grocery delivery startup Zepto said it's "deeply aggrieved" by the death of Karan Raju (Zepto delivery partner working with Zypp). Zepto said Karan was hit by a vehicle from behind "in what seems to be a hit-and-run incident in South Delhi". Zepto is giving financial aid of ₹10 lakh and an insurance grant of ₹8 lakh to Karan's family.

371.title: Indians living in SL asked to register details with High Commission
371.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka, has requested all Indian citizens who are currently living in Sri Lanka to register their details on hcicolombo.gov.in/registration. The High Commission has issued separate registration links for NRIs and students. This comes as Sri Lanka is reeling under an economic crisis, which has triggered a shortage of essential items, including food.

372.title: Right man in right party: Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder as Jakhar joins BJP
372.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Thursday congratulated ex-Congress leader Sunil Jakhar for joining the BJP. "Right man in the right party," said Singh, who quit Congress and formed his own party last year. He added, "Honest and upright leaders like him [Jakhar] cannot breathe in the Congress anymore."

373.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Thursday released
373.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that witnessed the highest maximum temperature on Thursday. Rajasthan's Barmer had the highest maximum temperature at 47.1°C, followed by 46.6°C in Churu and 46.5°C in Bikaner and Pilani. UP's Jhansi recorded 46.3°C and Rajasthan's Ganganagar recorded 46.2°C. Meanwhile, both Nowgong and Jaisalmer recorded 46°C.

374.title: I've asked Akshay if I could buy songs from his collection: Bhushan
374.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about actor Akshay Kumar, has said, "He is very passionate about music. He keeps calling for songs from different music composers, singers, or lyricists." Bhushan revealed Akshay has a "pandora box" of 400-500 different songs. "I once asked him if I could buy some songs from his collection, that's how huge it is," he added.

375.title: Female Afghan TV presenters must cover face on air, says Taliban
375.article_body: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have asked TV broadcasters to ensure that female presenters on local stations cover their faces when on air, an official said. This comes days after authorities ordered women to cover their faces in public. "Yesterday we met with media officials...they accepted our advice very happily," Akif Mahajar, spokesman for Taliban's Ministry of Vice and Virtue, said.

376.title: Punjab CM Mann meets Amit Shah in Delhi, discusses border security
376.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Thursday and discussed issues, including national security concerns and technology infrastructure needed to enhance border management. Centre will provide 10 companies of security forces to Punjab, Mann said. "We [have] requested anti-drone technology...other matters including...Punjab quota issue were also discussed," he added.

377.title: World's 2nd richest man Bezos shares magazine cover he framed as a 'reminder'
377.article_body: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to share an old magazine cover featuring him, and said, "I have this old 2006 BusinessWeek framed as a reminder." The magazine's cover featuring Bezos was titled, "Amazon's risky bet". Bezos tweeted, "The 'risky bet' that Wall Street disliked was AWS, which generated revenue of more than $62 billion last year."

378.title: Hindi has been our national language, we should respect that: Arjun
378.article_body: Arjun Rampal, talking about the national language debate, said, "Hindi has been our national language...we should respect that." Arjun added Hindi is spoken and understood the most across the country. "But that's not taking away from any other language," he added. This comes after Ajay Devgn-Kiccha Sudeep's Twitter row where Ajay had said that Hindi will remain the national language.

379.title: US town shuts down after its only clerk quits over vacation denial
379.article_body: The US town of Passadumkeag, which has about 350 residents, has effectively shut down until further notice after the town's only clerk quit. Christen Bouchard quit after being denied a two-week vacation because there wasn't anyone to take over during her temporary absence. The town can't issue vehicle registrations or inspect homes, and its office is closed since April 21.

380.title: CPI holds protest against arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad
380.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) protested against the arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad. "After the Telangana government was formed they are trying to sabotage everything by using police power and filing false cases and sending people to jail," CPI state secretary said. Viswam was arrested after he allegedly staged a protest while demanding houses for the poor.

381.title: CBI files FIR against WB Minister Adhikary, daughter over teacher appointment scam
381.article_body: CBI has registered an FIR against West Bengal Minister of State for School Education PC Adhikary and his daughter for failing to appear before it at the set time. Calcutta High Court had directed CBI to interrogate them over alleged appointment of his daughter as a teacher in a state government-aided school. Adhikary had mailed to CBI seeking more time.

382.title: Panvel civic body to set up 5 EV charging stations: Report
382.article_body: The Panvel Municipal Corporation (PMC) has reportedly decided to set up five charging stations to facilitate the charging of electric vehicles. These charging stations are expected to be set up along the expressway and highway. At one charging station, two four-wheelers and two-wheelers can be parked for charging. According to Panvel RTO, 1380 electric vehicles have been registered so far.

383.title: Retired army man found dead in his house in MP's Bhopal
383.article_body: A retired army personnel, identified as Mahendra Singh, was found dead in his house in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The deceased worked as a security supervisor at MANIT and lived alone, the police said. When the neighbours complained of foul smell, the police reached the deceased's house and found him lying dead on his bed.

384.title: Jeremy Renner shares pic of hanging off a truck in India, praises 'beautiful country'
384.article_body: Jeremy Renner, best known for playing 'Hawkeye' in the 'Avengers' movies, is currently in India. He shared a picture from his trip to India, which shows him hanging off a truck. On Thursday, he shared a selfie from Delhi, apparently from his hotel, and wrote, "Many blessings to you all from this beautiful country and culture."

385.title: Woman spends over ₹23 lakh to watch Depp-Amber trial in person: Report
385.article_body: Johnny Depp's female fan named Ivan De Boer has reportedly spent around $30,000 (₹23 lakh) to attend the actor's defamation trial against Amber Heard in person. "I took...whole year's vacation so I could be here for Depp," Ivan told the People magazine. "I'm the same age as Depp. I'm single, so I do what I want to, basically," she added.

386.title: Man booked for raping his 15-yr-old daughter in Navi Mumbai
386.article_body: Nerul police registered a case against a 42-year-old man for allegedly sexually assaulting his minor daughter repeatedly. Police said the accused ran away after the victim threatened to approach the police. The accused, a native of Jharkhand, was working as a cook in a bungalow in Nerul and brought his 15-year-old daughter here a year ago, they added.

387.title: GT to bat first against RCB, both teams make 1 change each
387.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against RCB in their final league stage match in IPL 2022. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Alzarri Joseph has been replaced by Lockie Ferguson in GT's playing XI, while Siddarth Kaul has replaced Mohammed Siraj in RCB's playing XI.

388.title: Portugal reports 5 confirmed cases of monkeypox as outbreak spreads
388.article_body: Health officials in Portugal said on Wednesday that five confirmed cases of monkeypox have been reported in men, adding that 15 suspected infections around the capital, Lisbon, are being investigated. This comes as confirmed monkeypox cases have also been found in the UK and US. Symptoms of monkeypox include fever, distinctive bumpy rash on one's face and other body parts.

389.title: PM Modi to attend Quad Summit in Japan on May 24: MEA
389.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the Quad Summit in Tokyo, Japan on May 24, Ministry Of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. This would be the fourth summit of Quad leaders. PM Modi will have bilateral meetings with his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida and US President Joe Biden, Bagchi added.

390.title: Frankfurt beat Rangers to win Europa League, end their 42-year European trophy drought
390.article_body: Eintracht Frankfurt defeated Rangers 5-4 on penalties in the final to win Europa League 2021/22. Before going into penalties, the match had ended in a 1-1 draw with Joe Aribo and Rafael Santos Borré scoring for Rangers and Eintracht Frankfurt, respectively. With the win, Eintracht Frankfurt ended their 42-year European trophy drought.

391.title: Anurag Thakur announces incentive schemes for foreign films shooting in India
391.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has announced an incentive scheme for audio-visual co-production and shooting of foreign films in India with "a cash incentive of up to 30% with a cap of $260,000". He added that foreign films that employ 15% or more manpower in India while shooting in the country will receive an additional bonus with a cap of $65,000.

392.title: Have not yet taken a decision on joining BJP or AAP: Hardik Patel
392.article_body: After resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said that he has not yet taken a decision on joining any other political party, be it BJP or AAP. Addressing a press conference, Hardik Patel criticised Congress, saying leaders of the party were biased against the people of Gujarat. "I wasted my three years in this party," Patel said.

393.title: Pichai, Aryabhatta have bigger fans than stars & actors put together: R Madhavan
393.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, who's attending the 75th Cannes Film Festival, on Thursday said, "From Aryabhatta to Sundar Pichai, we've such extraordinary stories as far as science and technology is concerned." He added, "We are not making movies about these people...They have bigger fans than stars and actors put together." Madhavan is making his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

394.title: Consequences of temper must be borne: SC while sentencing Sidhu to jail
394.article_body: While sentencing Navjot Singh Sidhu in a three-decade-old road rage case, the Supreme Court said, "Tempers may have been lost but then the consequences of the loss of temper must be borne." A 65-year-old man died in the incident. The court noted that Sidhu inflicted the blow to the man who was more than double his age at that time.

395.title: NATO has no plans to place nuclear arms, bases in Finland: PM Marin
395.article_body: NATO hasn't expressed any interest to place nuclear arms and bases in Finland, PM Sanna Marin has said. Marin's comments came after Finland and Sweden jointly submitted their applications to join the military alliance, a decision fuelled by the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has said that Sweden doesn't want permanent NATO bases on its territory.

396.title: Delhi's Ghazipur slaughterhouse shut for harming environment
396.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the East Delhi Municipal Corporation to hold Delhi's Ghazipur slaughterhouse's operating licence for violation of environmental norms. NGT said the plant will be allowed to operate only after the Central Pollution Control Board and the Delhi Pollution Control Committee certify that the slaughterhouse can be operated as per environment-related rules.

397.title: Pune-based AIT's few students fall sick, institute cites heat as reason
397.article_body: Some students of the Army Institute of Technology (AIT) in Pune complained of dysentery, stomach ache and vomiting from the night of May 14, officials said. The problems could have arisen due to high heat and less water intake, an official statement said. It added that outside food was stopped for two days as a precautionary measure.

398.title: Protect 'Brand Bengaluru': SM Krishna to K'taka CM amid rain havoc
398.article_body: Former Union minister SM Krishna has written a letter to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, urging him to take decisive steps to protect Bengaluru's image as recent rainfall created havoc in many areas. "The recent rain related havoc has…posed a threat to 'Brand Bengaluru' image which might also send a wrong message to the potential investors across the world," he wrote.

399.title: Over 7 lakh people in Assam's 29 districts affected by floods
399.article_body: Over seven lakh people have been affected due to floods across Assam's 29 districts, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said. Furthermore, nine people have died so far amid floods in the state, it added. Meanwhile, Assam Cabinet has introduced an emergency flight service between Silchar and Guwahati at subsidised rates amid disrupted rail and road link connectivity in several districts.

400.title: 206 kidney stones removed from 56-year-old man in Hyderabad
400.article_body: As many as 206 kidney stones were removed from a patient in Hyderabad's Aware Gleneagles Global Hospitals. The 56-year-old patient, Veeramalla Ramalakshmaiah, reportedly suffered from severe pain in his left loin due to stones for over six months, which was further aggravated due to soaring temperatures. The surgery lasted for an hour, post which patient recovered well, a doctor said.
